standard: AS 1000 - General Responsibilities of the Auditor in Conducting an Audit
description: Establishes the auditor's responsibilities in planning and performing an audit of financial statements in accordance with PCAOB standards.
enforcement_guidelines: Understand the entity and its environment, including its internal control.
Identify and assess risks of material misstatement, whether due to error or fraud.
Design and perform audit procedures responsive to the assessed risks.
Obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence to support the auditor's opinion.
Maintain independence and objectivity throughout the audit process.

standard: AS 1101 - Audit Risk
description: Requires the auditor to identify and assess risks of material misstatement in the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess risks of material misstatement, including the risk of management override of controls.
Design and perform audit procedures to address the assessed risks.
Document the identification, assessment, and response to risks of material misstatement.

standard: AS 1105 - Audit Evidence
description: Sets forth the auditor's responsibility to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence to support the auditor's opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence to support the auditor's opinion.
Evaluate the sufficiency and appropriateness of the audit evidence obtained.
Document the audit evidence obtained and the conclusions reached.

standard: AS 1000 - General Responsibilities of the Auditor in Conducting an Audit
description: The objectives of the auditor are to obtain reasonable assurance about the financial statements and internal control over financial reporting, and to communicate externally in accordance with applicable requirements.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement, whether due to error or fraud.
Issue an auditor's report expressing an opinion on the financial statements or internal control over financial reporting.
Communicate externally in accordance with applicable professional and legal requirements.

standard: AS 1000 - General Responsibilities of the Auditor in Conducting an Audit
description: The auditor must maintain independence in fact and appearance, satisfying independence criteria set out in PCAOB standards and SEC regulations.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure independence from the company under audit throughout the audit and professional engagement period.
Satisfy independence criteria set out in PCAOB standards and SEC rules and regulations.
Comply with applicable ethics requirements, including PCAOB ethics rules.

standard: AS 1000 - General Responsibilities of the Auditor in Conducting an Audit
description: The auditor must exercise due professional care, including professional skepticism, in all matters related to the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Exercise due professional care in all matters related to the audit, including acting with reasonable care and diligence.
Exercise professional skepticism by objectively evaluating evidence, remaining alert to conditions that may indicate misstatements, and not assuming management's honesty.
Consider potential bias on the part of management and the auditor.

standard: AS 1000 - General Responsibilities of the Auditor in Conducting an Audit
description: The auditor must exercise professional judgment in conducting the audit, applying relevant training, knowledge, and experience.
enforcement_guidelines: Exercise professional judgment in the context of conducting an audit with due professional care.
Apply relevant training, knowledge, and experience to make informed decisions and reach well-reasoned conclusions.

standard: AS 1000 - General Responsibilities of the Auditor in Conducting an Audit
description: The auditor must plan and perform the audit to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence to obtain reasonable assurance and form an opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Plan and perform the audit to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence.
Ensure the audit evidence supports the auditor's opinion on the financial statements or internal control over financial reporting.
Comply with applicable professional and legal requirements in conducting the audit.

standard: AS 1000 - General Responsibilities of the Auditor in Conducting an Audit
description: The auditor must prepare audit documentation and communicate externally in accordance with applicable requirements.
enforcement_guidelines: Prepare audit documentation to support significant conclusions and facilitate planning, performance, and supervision of the audit.
Communicate externally in accordance with applicable professional and legal requirements.
Ensure the auditor's report contains the appropriate expressions of opinion or disclaimers as required by the circumstances.

standard: AS 1101 - Audit Risk
description: The auditor must conduct the audit to reduce audit risk to an appropriately low level.
enforcement_guidelines: Plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement due to error or fraud.
Assess audit risk as a function of the risk of material misstatement and detection risk.
Apply due professional care, including obtaining sufficient appropriate audit evidence to reduce audit risk to an appropriately low level.

standard: AS 1101 - Audit Risk
description: This standard addresses the identification and assessment of risks of material misstatement in financial statements, including inherent risk, control risk, and detection risk.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the risks of material misstatement at both the financial statement level and the assertion level.
Understand the company's environment and internal controls to identify risks of material misstatement.
Design and perform audit procedures to address the assessed risks of material misstatement.
Evaluate the effectiveness of the company's internal controls in preventing or detecting material misstatements.

standard: AS 1105 - Audit Evidence
description: This standard establishes requirements for obtaining sufficient and appropriate audit evidence to support the auditor's opinion on the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Plan and perform audit procedures to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence.
Evaluate the relevance and reliability of audit evidence obtained from both internal and external sources.
Test the accuracy and completeness of information produced by the company for use as audit evidence.
Document the evaluation of the sufficiency and appropriateness of audit evidence obtained.

standard: AS 1105 - Audit Evidence
description: Requirements for selecting items for testing to obtain audit evidence.
enforcement_guidelines: Selecting all items (100 percent examination) when appropriate.
Selecting specific items based on specified characteristics.
Using audit sampling to test a portion of the population.

standard: AS 1105 - Audit Evidence
description: Guidelines for using the work of a company's specialist as audit evidence.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the specialist's knowledge, skill, and ability in the relevant field.
Evaluate the relationship between the specialist and the company to ensure independence.
Evaluate the work of the specialist to determine its sufficiency and appropriateness as audit evidence.

standard: AS 1105 - Audit Evidence
description: Auditors must evaluate the work of company specialists, considering the significance of their work and the risk of material misstatement.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the data, significant assumptions, and methods used by the specialist.
Assess the relevance and reliability of the specialist's work in relation to the relevant assertion.
Obtain more persuasive evidence if the significance of the specialist's work, the risk of material misstatement, or the company's influence on the specialist's judgments increases.

standard: AS 1105 - Audit Evidence
description: Auditors must obtain sufficient appropriate evidence regarding investee financial results when auditing equity method investments.
enforcement_guidelines: Read available financial statements of the investee and the accompanying audit report, if any.
Consider the investee's auditor's report and determine if it is satisfactory for the purpose of the audit.
Perform additional procedures if additional evidence is needed, such as reviewing investor files, making inquiries of investor management, or evaluating subsequent events and transactions.

standard: AS 1105 - Audit Evidence
description: Auditors must evaluate the work of the investee's auditor to ensure the sufficiency and appropriateness of audit evidence.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire about the professional reputation, standing, and independence of the investee's auditor.
Visit the investee's auditor and discuss audit procedures and results.
Review the audit program and working papers of the investee's auditor.

standard: AS 1110 - Relationship of Auditing Standards to Quality Control Standards
description: Establishes the relationship between auditing standards and quality control standards for firms conducting audits.
enforcement_guidelines: Adopt a system of quality control to ensure compliance with PCAOB standards.
Ensure quality control policies and procedures are in place for audit engagements.
Understand the relationship between auditing standards and quality control standards.

standard: AS 1201 - Supervision of the Audit Engagement
description: Requires proper supervision of the audit engagement and the work of engagement team members.
enforcement_guidelines: Inform engagement team members of their responsibilities.
Direct engagement team members to bring significant issues to the attention of the engagement partner.
Review the work of engagement team members to evaluate whether the work was performed as planned and supports the conclusions reached.

Consider the nature of the company, the nature of the assigned work, risks of material misstatement, and the knowledge, skill, and ability of each engagement team member when determining the extent of supervision.

standard: AS 1201 - Supervision of the Audit Engagement
description: This standard outlines the requirements for the lead auditor to supervise the work of other auditors and auditor-employed specialists in an audit engagement.
enforcement_guidelines: Inform the other auditor in writing about the scope of work and instructions for the audit.
Review the other auditor's written description of audit procedures and ensure they are performed in accordance with the lead auditor's instructions.
Determine if changes to the other auditor's planned audit procedures are necessary and communicate them in writing.
Obtain and review documentation provided by the other auditor to ensure compliance with PCAOB standards.
Evaluate the work of the other auditor and determine if additional procedures are needed to address any issues.
In multi-tiered audits, evaluate the first other auditor's supervision of the second other auditor's work and obtain necessary documentation.
For auditor-employed specialists, inform them of their responsibilities and ensure their work is coordinated with the audit team.
Review the specialist's report or documentation to ensure their work provides sufficient appropriate evidence.
Perform additional procedures if the specialist's findings or conclusions are inconsistent with the audit evidence or understanding of the company.

standard: AS 1206 - Dividing Responsibility for the Audit with Another Accounting Firm
description: Establishes requirements for lead auditors when dividing audit responsibility with referred-to auditors.
enforcement_guidelines: Communicate with the referred-to auditor and ensure proper performance of audit procedures.
Obtain written representations from the referred-to auditor regarding independence and licensing.
Ensure the referred-to auditor meets all necessary qualifications and compliance with PCAOB standards.
Take appropriate action if unable to divide responsibility, including performing additional procedures, qualifying the opinion, or withdrawing from the engagement.
Clearly reference the referred-to auditor's work in the lead auditor's report, including their name, report, and the portion of financial statements they audited.

standard: AS 1206 - Dividing Responsibility for the Audit with Another Accounting Firm
description: This standard outlines the responsibilities of the lead auditor when another accounting firm is involved in the audit of a company's financial statements. It specifies how the lead auditor should reference the work of the referred-to auditor in their report and the necessary procedures to ensure the integrity of the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess and respond to risks related to the referred-to auditor's work.
Obtain and evaluate the referred-to auditor's report on the financial statements.
Include specific language in the lead auditor's report regarding the referred-to auditor's work.
Ensure proper reference to the referred-to auditor's work in the lead auditor's report.

standard: AS 1210 - Using the Work of an Auditor-Engaged Specialist
description: This standard establishes requirements for auditors when using the work of a specialist engaged by the auditor's firm to assist in obtaining or evaluating audit evidence regarding a relevant assertion of a significant account or disclosure.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the specialist's knowledge, skill, ability, and objectivity in the particular field for the type of work under consideration.
Ensure the specialist has a sufficient level of knowledge, skill, and ability to perform the type of work under consideration.
Evaluate the specialist's objectivity, including any relationships between the specialist, their employer, and the company that could affect impartial judgment.

Inform the specialist of their responsibilities, including the objectives of the work, the nature of the work to be performed, the degree of responsibility, and the requirement to provide a report or equivalent documentation describing the work performed, results, and findings.

standard: AS 1210 - Using the Work of an Auditor-Engaged Specialist
description: Guidelines for auditors when using the work of specialists to ensure proper coordination and evaluation of their work.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure proper coordination between the specialist's work and the engagement team's work.
Review the specialist's report or equivalent documentation to evaluate sufficiency and appropriateness of evidence.
Perform additional procedures if the specialist's findings or conclusions appear to contradict relevant assertions or if the specialist's work does not provide sufficient appropriate evidence.

standard: AS 1215 - Audit Documentation
description: Requirements for audit documentation to support the auditor's conclusions and facilitate review of the engagement's quality.
enforcement_guidelines: Prepare audit documentation in sufficient detail to provide a clear understanding of its purpose, source, and conclusions reached.
Document procedures performed, evidence obtained, and conclusions reached with respect to relevant financial statement assertions.
Ensure documentation is organized to provide a clear link to significant findings or issues.

standard: AS 1215 - Audit Documentation
description: Audit documentation must include the following content: identification of the items inspected, results of auditing procedures, and significant findings or issues.
enforcement_guidelines: Document the identification of items inspected, including specific check numbers or other identifying characteristics.
Record the results of auditing procedures, including any significant findings or issues.
Maintain documentation of significant findings or issues, including any cross-references to supporting evidence.

standard: AS 1215 - Audit Documentation
description: Significant findings or issues must be documented, including disagreements among engagement team members or with others consulted.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and document significant findings or issues, including any inconsistencies with final conclusions.
Document disagreements among engagement team members or with others consulted, including the basis for final resolution.
Include cross-references to supporting audit documentation as necessary.

standard: AS 1215 - Audit Documentation
description: Audit documentation must be retained for seven years from the report release date or related dates.
enforcement_guidelines: Retain audit documentation for seven years from the report release date.
If no report is issued, retain documentation for seven years from the date fieldwork was substantially completed.
Document any additions to audit documentation after the report release date, including the date, preparer, and reason for the addition.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Specifies the applicability of the standard to audit engagements, reviews of interim financial information, and certain attestation engagements.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the standard applies to audit engagements, reviews of interim financial information, and attestation engagements regarding compliance or exemption reports of brokers and dealers.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Sets the objective of the engagement quality reviewer to evaluate significant judgments and conclusions in forming the overall conclusion and preparing the engagement report.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate significant judgments and conclusions related to engagement planning, risk assessment, and audit responses.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Defines the qualifications required for an engagement quality reviewer, including competence, independence, integrity, and objectivity.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the reviewer is an associated person of a registered public accounting firm.
Verify the reviewer's independence from the company and ability to perform the review with integrity and objectivity.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Outlines the process for conducting an engagement quality review in an audit engagement.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate significant judgments related to engagement planning, including consideration of recent engagement experience and risks.
Assess the engagement team's response to significant risks, including fraud risks.
Review documentation supporting conclusions on significant risks, identified misstatements, and control deficiencies.
Confirm that the engagement team appropriately addressed independence and engagement completion documentation.
Ensure the engagement report is appropriate and consistent with the conclusions reached.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Requires the engagement quality reviewer to evaluate the sufficiency of engagement documentation in supporting the audit conclusions.
enforcement_guidelines: Verify that documentation indicates appropriate responses to significant risks.
Confirm that documentation supports the conclusions reached by the engagement team.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Establishes the criteria for providing concurring approval of issuance by the engagement quality reviewer.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the reviewer is not aware of any significant engagement deficiencies.
Confirm that the engagement team obtained sufficient appropriate evidence.
Verify that the engagement team reached appropriate conclusions on the subject matter.
Ensure the engagement report is appropriate in the circumstances.
Confirm the firm's independence from the client.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Permission to use the engagement report is granted only after the engagement quality reviewer provides concurring approval of issuance.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain concurring approval of issuance from the engagement quality reviewer before granting permission to use the engagement report.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: The engagement quality reviewer must evaluate significant judgments and conclusions in forming the overall conclusion on the engagement and preparing the engagement report.
enforcement_guidelines: Hold discussions with the engagement partner and other team members.
Review documentation supporting the conclusions reached by the engagement team.
Evaluate the materiality and disposition of identified misstatements.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Concurring approval of issuance is provided only if the engagement quality reviewer is not aware of any significant engagement deficiencies.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform a thorough review of the engagement to identify any significant deficiencies.
Ensure that the engagement report is appropriate and that the firm maintains independence from the client.

standard: AS 1220 - Engagement Quality Review
description: Permission to use the engagement report is granted only after the engagement quality reviewer provides concurring approval of issuance.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain concurring approval of issuance from the engagement quality reviewer before granting permission to use the engagement report.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: The auditor must communicate with the audit committee regarding certain matters related to the audit and establish an understanding of the audit engagement terms.
enforcement_guidelines: Discuss the responsibilities of the audit committee with respect to the audit.
Obtain information from the audit committee relevant to the audit.
Document the understanding of the audit engagement terms in an engagement letter.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: This standard outlines the requirements for auditors to communicate effectively with audit committees regarding audit responsibilities, strategies, and significant findings.
enforcement_guidelines: Communicate the auditor's responsibilities and obtain information relevant to the audit from the audit committee.
Establish an understanding of the terms of the audit engagement with the audit committee and provide an engagement letter annually.
Communicate an overview of the overall audit strategy, including timing and significant risks, to the audit committee.
Provide the audit committee with timely observations arising from the audit that are significant to the financial reporting process.
Communicate significant changes to the planned audit strategy or significant risks to the audit committee.
Discuss with the audit committee any significant issues discussed with management in connection with the auditor's appointment or retention.
Communicate to the audit committee significant accounting policies, critical accounting estimates, and significant unusual transactions.
Evaluate and communicate the quality of the company's financial reporting, including the presentation of financial statements and related disclosures.
Communicate any concerns regarding management's anticipated application of new accounting pronouncements that might significantly affect future financial reporting.
Communicate to the audit committee any matters that are difficult or contentious and were consulted outside the engagement team.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: Auditors must communicate concerns about significant auditing or accounting matters discussed with management to the audit committee.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify concerns regarding significant auditing or accounting matters.
Communicate concerns to the audit committee.
Document the communication in audit work papers.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: Auditors must communicate matters relating to the evaluation of the company's ability to continue as a going concern to the audit committee.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether there is substantial doubt about the company's ability to continue as a going concern.
Communicate conditions and events indicating substantial doubt to the audit committee.
Discuss the basis for conclusions regarding substantial doubt with the audit committee.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: Auditors must provide the audit committee with a schedule of uncorrected misstatements and discuss the immateriality of such misstatements.
enforcement_guidelines: Prepare a schedule of uncorrected misstatements.
Discuss the immateriality of uncorrected misstatements with the audit committee.
Document the discussion in audit work papers.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: Auditors must communicate corrected misstatements to the audit committee and discuss their implications.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify corrected misstatements that are not clearly trivial.
Communicate these misstatements to the audit committee.
Discuss the implications of these misstatements with the audit committee.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: Auditors must communicate other material written communications between the auditor and management to the audit committee.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify material written communications between the auditor and management.
Communicate these communications to the audit committee.
Document the communication in audit work papers.

standard: AS 1301 - Communications with Audit Committees
description: This standard outlines the requirements for auditors to communicate with audit committees regarding internal control deficiencies, material weaknesses, and significant deficiencies. It also specifies the responsibilities of management and the auditor in ensuring proper communication and documentation.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess material weaknesses and significant deficiencies in internal control over financial reporting.
Communicate all material weaknesses and significant deficiencies to the audit committee and management in writing.
Ensure that management provides a written confirmation of their understanding and responsibilities regarding internal control deficiencies.
Document all communications with the audit committee and management in accordance with AS 1215, Audit Documentation.
Review and update the audit engagement letter to reflect the responsibilities of the auditor and the company regarding internal control communication.

standard: AS 1305 - Communications About Control Deficiencies in an Audit of Financial Statements
description: This standard establishes requirements for auditors to identify and communicate control deficiencies, including significant deficiencies and material weaknesses, in internal control over financial reporting.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess control deficiencies, distinguishing between significant deficiencies and material weaknesses.
Communicate in writing to management and the audit committee all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses prior to the issuance of the auditor's report.
Clearly distinguish between significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in written communications.
Avoid reporting that no significant deficiencies were discovered due to the potential for misunderstanding the limited assurance associated with such a report.
Communicate matters during the audit if timely communication is important, especially for significant or urgent issues.

standard: AS 2101 - Audit Planning
description: This standard outlines the responsibilities of the lead auditor when planning an audit that involves other auditors or referred-to auditors. It emphasizes the importance of proper planning, including establishing the overall audit strategy and developing an audit plan.
enforcement_guidelines: Determine compliance with SEC independence requirements and PCAOB independence and ethics requirements for each other auditor.
Obtain a written affirmation from each other auditor regarding their compliance with independence and ethics requirements.
Evaluate the knowledge, skill, and ability of the other auditor's engagement team members.
Ensure that the lead auditor can communicate with the other auditor and gain access to the other auditor's audit documentation.

standard: AS 2101 - Audit Planning
description: The auditor must develop and document an audit plan that includes risk assessment procedures, tests of controls, and other audit procedures.
enforcement_guidelines: Develop and document an audit plan that includes risk assessment procedures.
Include tests of controls and substantive procedures in the audit plan.
Ensure the audit plan addresses all necessary audit procedures for compliance.

standard: AS 2101 - Audit Planning
description: In multi-location engagements, the auditor must assess risks and determine audit procedures for each location.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess risks of material misstatement for each location or business unit.
Determine the nature, timing, and extent of audit procedures for each location.
Correlate audit attention with the degree of risk associated with each location.

standard: AS 2101 - Audit Planning
description: The auditor must modify the audit plan if circumstances change during the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Monitor for significant changes in circumstances during the audit.
Modify the overall audit strategy and audit plan as necessary.
Document any changes to the audit plan and the reasons for the changes.

standard: AS 2101 - Audit Planning
description: The auditor must determine if specialized skill or knowledge is needed for the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the need for specialized skill or knowledge for the audit.
Ensure that individuals with the required expertise are involved in the audit.
Evaluate the results of procedures performed by specialists to ensure they meet audit objectives.

standard: AS 2105 - Consideration of Materiality in Planning and Performing an Audit
description: This standard establishes requirements for auditors to appropriately consider materiality in planning and performing audits, including the establishment of materiality levels and tolerable misstatement.
enforcement_guidelines: Establish a materiality level for the financial statements as a whole, considering the company's circumstances.
Evaluate whether certain accounts or disclosures may have misstatements that could influence the judgment of a reasonable investor due to qualitative factors.
Determine tolerable misstatement for individual accounts or disclosures to reduce the probability of material misstatement of the financial statements.
Reevaluate and adjust the materiality level or tolerable misstatement when circumstances change or additional information indicates a need for adjustment.

standard: AS 2105 - Consideration of Materiality in Planning and Performing an Audit
description: Auditors must reevaluate materiality levels and adjust audit procedures if a lower amount is identified.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the impact of the lower materiality level on risk assessments and audit procedures.
Modify the nature, timing, and extent of audit procedures as necessary.
Consider the effect of the reevaluation on the assessment of internal control over financial reporting.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Auditors must perform risk assessment procedures to identify and assess risks of material misstatement.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform risk assessment procedures to provide a reasonable basis for identifying and assessing risks of material misstatement.
Obtain an understanding of the company's industry, regulatory environment, and other external factors.
Understand the company's nature, objectives, strategies, and business risks.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Auditors must understand the company's financial relationships with executive officers.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform procedures to identify risks of material misstatement related to financial relationships with executive officers.
Read employment and compensation contracts with executive officers.
Review proxy statements and other relevant filings with regulatory agencies.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: In a divided-responsibility audit, the referred-to auditor should inquire of the lead auditor regarding matters significant to their audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire about transactions, adjustments, or other matters affecting the financial statements.
Assess the impact of these matters on the referred-to auditor's audit.
Document the findings and conclusions from the inquiry.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Evaluate the company's selection and application of accounting principles and related disclosures.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess significant changes in accounting principles or policies.
Evaluate the company's financial reporting competencies.
Identify accounts requiring judgment in applying accounting principles.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Obtain an understanding of internal control over financial reporting to identify potential misstatements.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the design of relevant controls.
Determine if controls have been implemented.
Perform walkthroughs to confirm control effectiveness.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Assess the company's control environment, including management's philosophy and board oversight.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate management's philosophy and operating style.
Assess the board's oversight of financial reporting.
Identify control deficiencies in the control environment.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Understand the company's risk assessment process for financial reporting risks.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify risks relevant to financial reporting objectives.
Assess the likelihood and significance of misstatements.
Evaluate management's actions to address identified risks.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Auditors must obtain an understanding of the company's information system relevant to financial reporting and perform walkthroughs to assess risks of material misstatement.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain an understanding of the information system, including classes of transactions, procedures, accounting records, and period-end financial reporting processes.
Understand how the company communicates financial reporting roles and responsibilities.
Perform walkthroughs to understand the flow of transactions, evaluate control designs, and determine if controls are implemented.
Use probing questions during walkthroughs to identify important points where controls may be missing or ineffective.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: The key engagement team members should discuss the potential for material misstatement due to fraud, including the susceptibility of the company's financial statements to material misstatement through related party transactions, omission or presentation of incomplete or inaccurate disclosures, and management bias in accounting estimates.
enforcement_guidelines: Conduct discussions among key engagement team members regarding the potential for material misstatement due to fraud.
Identify and assess risks of material misstatement at the financial statement level and the assertion level.
Evaluate the likelihood and magnitude of potential misstatement to assess the possibility of material misstatement.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: The auditor should inquire of the audit committee, management, internal audit function, and others within the company about the risks of material misstatement, including fraud risks.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire of management regarding the company's process for identifying and responding to fraud risks, including any specific fraud risks identified and controls established to address them.
Inquire of the audit committee regarding their oversight of fraud risks, including their knowledge of fraud, alleged fraud, or suspected fraud affecting the company.
Inquire of internal audit personnel regarding their views about fraud risks, including their knowledge of fraud, alleged fraud, or suspected fraud affecting the company.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: The auditor should identify and assess the risks of material misstatement at the financial statement level and the assertion level, including evaluating the likelihood and magnitude of potential misstatement.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify risks of misstatement using information obtained from performing risk assessment procedures.
Evaluate whether identified risks relate pervasively to the financial statements as a whole and potentially affect many assertions.
Evaluate the types of potential misstatements that could result from the identified risks and the accounts, disclosures, and assertions that could be affected.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Identifying and assessing risks of material misstatement in financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate risk factors such as size, susceptibility to misstatement, volume of activity, complexity, and accounting estimates.
Consider the likelihood and potential magnitude of misstatements.
Assess whether risks are fraud risks or related to significant unusual transactions.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Evaluating fraud risk factors in the context of financial statement audits.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify fraud risk factors related to incentives, opportunities, and rationalizations for fraud.
Consider how fraud could be perpetrated or concealed through incomplete or inaccurate disclosures.
Presume fraud risk involving improper revenue recognition and evaluate related risks.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Determining significant risks of material misstatement.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate quantitative and qualitative risk factors affecting the likelihood and magnitude of misstatements.
Consider whether risks are fraud risks or related to recent developments, complex transactions, or significant unusual transactions.
Assess the complexity or judgment in financial information recognition or measurement.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Evaluating controls addressing fraud and significant risks.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the design and implementation of controls addressing fraud risks and significant risks.
Consider controls that prevent, deter, and detect fraud, including those addressing management override.
Understand controls related to significant unusual transactions and their impact on financial statements.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Auditors must understand how the company has responded to risks arising from information technology (IT).
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain an understanding of the company's response to IT-related risks.

standard: AS 2110 - Identifying and Assessing Risks of Material Misstatement
description: When relying on manual controls, auditors must design procedures to test the consistency of their application.
enforcement_guidelines: Design audit procedures to test the consistency of manual control application.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: Establishes requirements for auditing internal control over financial reporting integrated with financial statement audits.
enforcement_guidelines: Understand the company's internal control over financial reporting.
Assess the effectiveness of internal controls.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: Provides direction for planning the audit of internal control over financial reporting.
enforcement_guidelines: Plan the audit to include understanding and testing of internal controls.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: Guidance on using a top-down approach to identify and assess risks.
enforcement_guidelines: Use a top-down approach to identify and assess risks of material misstatement.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: Requirements for testing controls during the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Test controls to evaluate their effectiveness in preventing or detecting material misstatements.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: Guidance on evaluating identified deficiencies in internal control.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the severity of identified control deficiencies.
Determine the impact on the audit opinion.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: Requirements for wrapping up the audit of internal control.
enforcement_guidelines: Complete all necessary audit procedures.
Prepare the final audit report.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: The objective of tests of controls in an audit of internal control over financial reporting is to obtain evidence about the effectiveness of controls to support the auditor's opinion on the company's internal control over financial reporting.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the effectiveness of controls in preventing or detecting material misstatements.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: To express an opinion on internal control over financial reporting, the auditor must obtain evidence that internal control over financial reporting has operated effectively for a sufficient period of time.

Obtain evidence through testing of controls over the identified period.
Evaluate whether the evidence supports the conclusion on the effectiveness of internal control.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements
description: The auditor must consider the controls at a service organization when auditing internal control over financial reporting, especially when the service organization's controls are part of the company's information system.

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2201 - An Audit of Internal Control Over Financial Reporting That Is Integrated with An Audit of Financial Statements

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement

Evaluate the company's selection and application of significant accounting principles, particularly those related to subjective measurements and complex transactions, to identify potential biases that could lead to material misstatement.

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement

enforcement_guidelines: Identify relevant assertions where tests of controls are necessary.

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement

enforcement_guidelines: Perform procedures to test design effectiveness of controls.

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Auditors must test the operating effectiveness of controls to determine if they are operating as designed.

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Auditors must assess control risk based on evidence obtained from all sources.

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement
description: Auditors must evaluate the severity of control deficiencies and their impact on control risk assessments.

standard: AS 2301 - The Auditor's Responses to the Risks of Material Misstatement

standard: AS 2305 - Substantive Analytical Procedures
description: This standard establishes requirements for the use of substantive analytical procedures in an audit, including the development of expectations, evaluation of significant differences, and documentation of procedures.

standard: AS 2310 - The Auditor’s Use of Confirmation
description: This standard establishes requirements for auditors to obtain relevant and reliable audit evidence through the use of confirmation. standard: AS 2310 - The Auditor’s Use of Confirmation

standard: AS 2310 - The Auditor’s Use of Confirmation
description: Auditors must follow up on nonresponses to positive confirmation requests and evaluate any subsequent responses.
enforcement_guidelines: Follow up on nonresponses to positive confirmation requests.
Evaluate any subsequent confirmation responses received.

standard: AS 2310 - The Auditor’s Use of Confirmation

standard: AS 2315 - Audit Sampling

standard: AS 2315 - Audit Sampling

standard: AS 2315 - Audit Sampling

standard: AS 2315 - Audit Sampling

standard: AS 2401 - Consideration of Fraud in a Financial Statement Audit

description: Auditors must examine journal entries and other adjustments to detect potential fraud, focusing on entries made at the end of the reporting period.

standard: AS 2401 - Consideration of Fraud in a Financial Statement Audit

standard: AS 2401 - Consideration of Fraud in a Financial Statement Audit
description: Guidelines for auditors to identify, assess, and respond to risks of material misstatement due to fraud in financial statements.

standard: AS 2401 - Consideration of Fraud in a Financial Statement Audit

standard: AS 2401 - Consideration of Fraud in a Financial Statement Audit

standard: AS 2405 - Illegal Acts by Clients

Explain the implications of management's assertions regarding arm's-length transactions and the evidence obtained to support or contradict such assertions.

standard: AS 2415 - Consideration of an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
description: The auditor must evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern for a reasonable period of time, based on conditions and events identified during the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate conditions and events that indicate substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern.
Assess the likelihood of management's plans to mitigate adverse effects being effectively implemented.
Conclude whether there is substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern and communicate findings appropriately.

standard: AS 2415 - Consideration of an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
description: The auditor should perform audit procedures to identify conditions and events that may indicate substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform analytical procedures to identify negative trends and other indicators of financial difficulties.
Review subsequent events that may affect the entity's ability to continue as a going concern.
Consider internal matters such as work stoppages or substantial dependence on a particular project.
Evaluate external matters such as legal proceedings or loss of key customers.

standard: AS 2415 - Consideration of an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
description: Auditors must request and assess prospective financial information, focusing on significant assumptions, especially those that are material, sensitive, or inconsistent with historical trends.
enforcement_guidelines: Request management to provide prospective financial information.
Assess the adequacy of support for significant assumptions underlying the information.
Give particular attention to assumptions that are material, sensitive, or inconsistent with historical trends.
Compare prospective financial information with prior periods and actual results.
Discuss factors not reflected in the prospective financial information with management.

standard: AS 2415 - Consideration of an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
description: When substantial doubt exists, auditors must evaluate the effects on financial statements and ensure adequate disclosure.
enforcement_guidelines: Consider the possible effects of conditions and events on the financial statements.
Assess the adequacy of related disclosures.
Include information about conditions, events, management's evaluation, and possible discontinuance of operations.

standard: AS 2415 - Consideration of an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
description: If substantial doubt remains, the audit report must include an explanatory paragraph.
enforcement_guidelines: Include an explanatory paragraph immediately following the opinion paragraph.
Use the phrase 'substantial doubt about its ability to continue as a going concern'.

standard: AS 2415 - Consideration of an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
description: Auditors must document their evaluation of conditions, management's plans, and conclusions regarding substantial doubt.
enforcement_guidelines: Document conditions or events leading to substantial doubt.
Document significant elements of management's plans.
Document auditing procedures and evidence obtained.
Document conclusions on whether substantial doubt remains or is alleviated.
Document conclusions on the need for disclosure.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: Auditors must obtain sufficient appropriate evidence to determine whether accounting estimates in significant accounts and disclosures are properly accounted for and disclosed in the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess risks of material misstatement related to accounting estimates.
Test the company's process used to develop the accounting estimate.
Develop an independent expectation for comparison to the company's estimate.
Evaluate audit evidence from events or transactions occurring after the measurement date related to the accounting estimate.
Use the work of a company's specialist if applicable.
Evaluate third-party pricing information when auditing the fair values of financial instruments.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: Auditors must independently derive assumptions or use their own methods when developing an independent expectation, ensuring a reasonable basis for these assumptions and methods.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure assumptions and methods used are reasonable and well-supported.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: When using data or assumptions from a third party, the auditor must evaluate their relevance and reliability in accordance with AS 1105.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the relevance and reliability of third-party data and assumptions.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: If the auditor uses company data, assumptions, or methods, they must test the data, evaluate the reasonableness of assumptions, and assess the methods used.
enforcement_guidelines: Test company data in accordance with paragraphs .12–.14.
Evaluate the reasonableness of significant assumptions in accordance with paragraphs .16–.18.
Evaluate company methods in accordance with paragraphs .10–.11.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: When developing an independent expectation as a range, the range must encompass only reasonable outcomes and be supported by sufficient appropriate evidence.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the range encompasses only reasonable outcomes.
Confirm that the range is supported by sufficient appropriate evidence.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: The auditor must compare their independent expectation to the company's estimate and evaluate differences in accordance with AS 2810.13.
enforcement_guidelines: Compare the auditor's independent expectation to the company's estimate.
Evaluate differences in accordance with AS 2810.13.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: Auditors must evaluate whether audit evidence from events or transactions occurring after the measurement date is sufficient, reliable, and relevant to the company's accounting estimate.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the sufficiency, reliability, and relevance of audit evidence from post-measurement date events or transactions.
Assess whether the evidence supports or contradicts the company's estimate.

standard: AS 2501 - Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Measurements
description: Auditors must evaluate audit results, including identified misstatements, potential bias in estimates, and the presentation of financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate identified misstatements.
Assess potential bias in accounting estimates.
Evaluate the presentation of financial statements, including disclosures and essential information.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: Guidance on procedures for identifying litigation, claims, and assessments and ensuring proper financial reporting.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain evidential matter regarding the existence of conditions indicating uncertainty as to the outcome of litigation, claims, or assessments.
Assess the likelihood of an unfavorable outcome of the litigation, claims, or assessments.
Evaluate the ability to estimate the financial effect of the unfavorable outcome.
Ensure adequate disclosure of the nature of the litigation, claims, or assessments and their potential financial impact.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: This standard outlines the procedures an auditor must follow to inquire with a client's lawyer about litigation, claims, and assessments to ensure proper financial reporting.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire of and discuss with management about their policies and procedures for identifying, evaluating, and accounting for litigation, claims, and assessments.
Obtain from management a description and evaluation of pending or threatened litigation, claims, and assessments, including those referred to legal counsel.
Examine documents in the client's possession concerning litigation, claims, and assessments, such as correspondence and invoices from lawyers.
Obtain written assurance from management that they have disclosed all matters required by Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 5.
Send an inquiry letter to the client's lawyer to corroborate the information provided by management regarding litigation, claims, and assessments.
Consider the lawyer's response, including any limitations or refusals to provide information, which may affect the auditor's opinion.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: This standard outlines the proper procedure for auditors to inquire with a client's lawyer regarding litigation, claims, and assessments, ensuring that such inquiries are conducted in a manner that respects client confidentiality and professional standards.
enforcement_guidelines: The lawyer may properly respond to the auditor's requests for information concerning loss contingencies if the client has consented to such disclosure and the lawyer has been engaged by the client to represent or advise the client professionally with respect to such matters.
The lawyer's response should be limited to items which are considered individually or collectively material to the presentation of the client's financial statements.

The lawyer should identify and describe overtly threatened or pending litigation, contractually assumed obligations, or unasserted possible claims or assessments that the client has specifically identified.
The lawyer should provide information concerning the stage of the proceedings, the claim(s) asserted, and the position taken by the client.
The lawyer should refrain from expressing judgments as to the outcome of the matter unless it is clear that an unfavorable outcome is either 'probable' or 'remote'.
The lawyer should not be required to provide estimates of potential loss unless the probability of inaccuracy of the estimate is slight.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: The lawyer must advise the client on the need for public disclosure of loss contingencies and may be required to resign if the client disregards this advice.
enforcement_guidelines: Advise the client on the necessity of public disclosure of loss contingencies.
Resign from the engagement if the client disregards advice on disclosure requirements.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: The lawyer's response is limited to matters within their professional engagement and excludes information obtained in other capacities, such as being a director or officer.
enforcement_guidelines: Limit response to matters handled in a professional capacity.
Exclude information obtained as a director or officer unless it pertains to the legal engagement.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: The lawyer may limit their response to material items, provided they communicate this limitation to the auditor.
enforcement_guidelines: Limit response to material items if agreed upon with the auditor.
Clearly communicate any limitations on the scope of the response.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: The lawyer must respond to the auditor's inquiry regarding loss contingencies in accordance with FAS 5, providing information on the likelihood and estimation of losses.
enforcement_guidelines: Respond to the auditor's inquiry regarding loss contingencies.
Provide information on the likelihood and estimation of losses as per FAS 5.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: Auditors must assess the probability of unfavorable outcomes in litigation and ensure proper disclosure or accrual of loss contingencies in financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire of the client's lawyer regarding the probability of an unfavorable outcome in litigation, including whether the outcome is 'probable,' 'reasonably possible,' or 'remote.'
Verify that the lawyer's assessment of the probability of an unfavorable outcome is based on sufficient evidence and professional judgment.
Ensure that the client's financial statements disclose or accrue loss contingencies in accordance with FAS 5, including estimates of potential losses where appropriate.

standard: AS 2505 - Inquiry of a Client's Lawyer Concerning Litigation, Claims, and Assessments
description: Auditors must inquire of the client's lawyer regarding litigation, claims, and assessments to identify and assess risks related to loss and gain contingencies.
enforcement_guidelines: Request written responses from the client's lawyer regarding loss and gain contingencies.
Review the lawyer's response to identify any material loss or gain contingencies.
Evaluate the sufficiency of the lawyer's response and consider the need for additional procedures.
Document the inquiry process and any findings in the audit workpapers.

standard: AS 2510 - Auditing Inventories
description: Guidance for auditors when inventories are held in public warehouses, emphasizing the need to obtain reasonable assurance regarding the existence and condition of such inventories.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain direct written confirmation from the warehouse custodian regarding the existence and condition of the inventories.
Test the owner's procedures for investigating the warehouseman and evaluating the warehouseman's performance.
Observe physical counts of the goods if practicable and reasonable.
If warehouse receipts have been pledged as collateral, confirm with lenders pertinent details of the pledged receipts on a test basis, if appropriate.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: Guidance for user auditors when the entity uses a service organization that is part of its information system, including considerations for evaluating the service organization's controls and obtaining reports from service auditors.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate whether the service organization's controls are part of the user organization's information system and assess their relevance to the user organization's internal control.
Obtain a report from the service auditor regarding the service organization's controls that may be relevant to the user organization's internal control.
Test the operating effectiveness of the service organization's controls if the user auditor intends to use the service auditor's work as audit evidence.
Consider the sufficiency and appropriateness of the evidence obtained from the service auditor's work.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: Auditors must consider the impact of a service organization on the user organization's internal controls and the availability of evidence to plan the audit, assess control risk, and perform substantive procedures.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain an understanding of the service organization's controls and their interaction with the user organization's controls.
Assess the sufficiency of evidence provided by the service auditor's report and consider additional procedures if necessary.
Evaluate the operating effectiveness of controls at the service organization if relevant to the user organization's financial statements.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: User auditors must evaluate the service auditor's report to determine its relevance to the user organization's financial statements and assess the effectiveness of controls at the service organization.
enforcement_guidelines: Consider the professional reputation of the service auditor.
Review the service auditor's report and assess its relevance to the user organization's financial statements.
Supplement the service auditor's report with additional procedures if necessary to meet audit objectives.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: This standard outlines the requirements for service auditors when evaluating and reporting on the controls of a service organization that may be relevant to a user organization's internal control over financial reporting.
enforcement_guidelines: Determine whether the service organization's description of controls provides sufficient information for user auditors to understand the controls that may be relevant to their internal control over financial reporting.
Assess whether the controls were suitably designed to achieve the specified control objectives and whether they were placed in operation as of a specific date.

Communicate any significant deficiencies in the design or operation of the service organization's controls to the appropriate parties, including the service organization's management and audit committee.

Include in the report any significant changes to the service organization's controls that occurred before the beginning of the fieldwork and that would be considered significant by user organizations and their auditors.

Consider whether to resign from the engagement if the service organization's management refuses to communicate significant deficiencies to user organizations and the audit committee does not respond appropriately.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: Requirements for a service auditor's report on controls placed in operation and tests of operating effectiveness.
enforcement_guidelines: Include a specific reference to the applications, services, products, or other aspects of the service organization covered.
Describe the scope and nature of the service auditor's procedures.
Identify the party specifying the control objectives.
State the purpose of the engagement and the opinion on the description of controls.
Include a description of tests of operating effectiveness and their results.
State the period covered by the report.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: Service auditor's responsibility to consider significant deficiencies in the service organization's controls.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify conditions that represent significant deficiencies in the design or operation of controls.
Assess whether such deficiencies could adversely affect the ability to achieve control objectives.
Determine if user organizations would generally have controls to mitigate such deficiencies.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: Requirements for the service auditor to express an opinion on the design of controls.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the service organization identifies and appropriately describes control objectives and relevant controls.
Assess the linkage between controls and control objectives.
Obtain sufficient evidence to support the opinion on the design of controls.

standard: AS 2601 - Consideration of an Entity's Use of a Service Organization
description: Guidance for service auditors in evaluating and reporting on the controls of a service organization relevant to user organizations' financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the accuracy and completeness of the service organization's control descriptions.
Report on the design and operating effectiveness of the service organization's controls.
Identify and report any significant deficiencies in the service organization's controls.
Consider subsequent events that may affect user organizations and disclose them if necessary.
Obtain written representations from the service organization's management regarding controls and subsequent events.

standard: AS 2605 - Consideration of the Internal Audit Function
description: Guidance for auditors on considering the work of internal auditors and using internal auditors to provide direct assistance in an audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Consider the internal audit function's role in the entity's internal control over financial reporting.
Assess the competence and objectivity of the internal auditors.
Evaluate the effectiveness of the internal auditors' work and consider it in determining the nature, timing, and extent of the auditor's procedures.
Coordinate audit work with internal auditors to avoid duplication of effort and to enhance the efficiency of the audit.
Document the auditor's consideration of the internal audit function and the use of internal auditors' work in the audit documentation.

standard: AS 2605 - Consideration of the Internal Audit Function
description: Auditors must consider the work of the internal audit function when planning and performing the audit of financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain an understanding of the internal audit function's activities relevant to the audit.
Assess the competence and objectivity of the internal auditors.
Consider the internal auditors' work when planning audit procedures.
Ensure that the internal auditors' work does not diminish the auditor's responsibility for the audit opinion.

standard: AS 2605 - Consideration of the Internal Audit Function
description: Auditors must evaluate the work of internal auditors and determine if it reduces audit risk to an acceptable level for certain financial statement assertions.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess the risk of material misstatement for each financial statement assertion.
Evaluate the work performed by internal auditors related to significant financial statement assertions.
Determine if the internal auditors' work reduces audit risk to an acceptable level for assertions with low risk of material misstatement or low subjectivity in audit evidence evaluation.

standard: AS 2605 - Consideration of the Internal Audit Function
description: Auditors should coordinate their work with internal auditors to enhance audit efficiency and effectiveness.
enforcement_guidelines: Hold periodic meetings with internal auditors to discuss audit plans and findings.
Schedule audit work to align with internal audit activities where appropriate.
Provide access to internal auditors' working papers for review and evaluation.
Review internal audit reports to identify potential risks and areas requiring further investigation.

standard: AS 2605 - Consideration of the Internal Audit Function
description: Auditors must evaluate the quality and effectiveness of internal auditors' work when it significantly affects the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether the internal auditors' scope of work is appropriate for meeting audit objectives.
Evaluate the adequacy of internal auditors' audit programs and working papers.
Review the appropriateness of internal auditors' conclusions in the context of the audit.
Ensure that internal auditors' reports are consistent with the results of their work.

standard: AS 2605 - Consideration of the Internal Audit Function
description: Auditors may request direct assistance from internal auditors, provided certain conditions are met.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the competence and objectivity of internal auditors before requesting their assistance.
Supervise, review, and evaluate the work performed by internal auditors when providing direct assistance.
Ensure internal auditors are informed of their responsibilities and the objectives of the audit procedures.
Ensure internal auditors are aware of all significant accounting and auditing issues identified during the audit.

standard: AS 2610 - Initial Audits—Communications Between Predecessor and Successor Auditors
description: Successor auditor must inquire with predecessor auditor before accepting engagement.
enforcement_guidelines: Make specific and reasonable inquiries regarding management's integrity.
Inquire about disagreements with management on accounting principles or auditing procedures.
Inquire about communications to audit committees regarding fraud or illegal acts.
Inquire about the predecessor auditor's understanding of the reasons for the change of auditors.

standard: AS 2610 - Initial Audits—Communications Between Predecessor and Successor Auditors
description: Successor auditor must obtain sufficient audit evidence regarding opening balances and consistency of accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Review predecessor auditor's report and working papers.
Perform audit procedures on current period transactions to provide evidence about opening balances.
Evaluate the consistency of accounting principles applied in the current period.

standard: AS 2610 - Initial Audits—Communications Between Predecessor and Successor Auditors
description: Successor auditor must handle possible misstatements in predecessor-audited financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Inform the predecessor auditor of discovered misstatements.
Arrange for a discussion between the successor auditor, predecessor auditor, and client.
Evaluate the implications of unresolved misstatements on the current engagement.
Consult with legal counsel if necessary.

standard: AS 2610 - Initial Audits—Communications Between Predecessor and Successor Auditors
description: This standard outlines the communication requirements between predecessor and successor auditors during an initial audit. It emphasizes the importance of obtaining client consent for access to predecessor auditor's working papers and ensuring proper documentation of such communications.
enforcement_guidelines: Request authorization from the client to review the predecessor auditor's working papers.
Use the illustrative client consent and acknowledgment letter provided in Appendix A for documentation purposes.
Obtain a written communication from the successor auditor regarding the use of the working papers before granting access.
Confirm that the successor auditor agrees to the limitations on the use of the working papers as outlined in the standard.

standard: AS 2701 - Auditing Supplemental Information Accompanying Audited Financial Statements
description: This standard establishes the auditor's responsibilities when auditing supplemental information that accompanies audited financial statements. The objective is to ensure that the supplemental information is fairly presented in relation to the audited financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform audit procedures on the supplemental information to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence.
Obtain management representations regarding the accuracy and completeness of the supplemental information.
Evaluate the audit results and determine if the supplemental information is fairly stated in all material respects.
Report on the fairness of the supplemental information in relation to the audited financial statements.

standard: AS 2701 - Auditing Supplemental Information Accompanying Audited Financial Statements
description: This standard outlines the requirements for auditing supplemental information that accompanies audited financial statements, including the performance of audit procedures, obtaining management representations, and evaluating audit results.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform audit procedures to obtain appropriate audit evidence that the supplemental information is fairly stated in relation to the financial statements as a whole.
Obtain an understanding of the purpose, criteria, and methods used to prepare the supplemental information.
Inquire of management about significant assumptions or interpretations underlying the measurement or presentation of the supplemental information.
Determine that the supplemental information reconciles to the underlying accounting and other records or to the financial statements, as applicable.
Perform procedures to test the completeness and accuracy of the information presented in the supplemental information.
Evaluate whether the supplemental information complies with relevant regulatory requirements or other applicable criteria.
Obtain written representations from management regarding their responsibility for the fair presentation of the supplemental information.
Evaluate whether uncorrected misstatements related to the supplemental information are material, either individually or in combination with other misstatements.
Evaluate the effect of any modifications to the audit report on the financial statements when forming an opinion on the supplemental information.

Include specific statements in the auditor's report on the supplemental information, such as identification of the supplemental information, management's responsibility, and the nature of audit procedures performed.

standard: AS 2705 - Required Supplementary Information
description: This standard establishes the auditor's responsibilities when required supplementary information accompanies audited financial statements. It outlines the procedures to be applied and the reporting requirements for such information.
enforcement_guidelines: Determine if supplementary information is required by GAAP and accompanies the audited financial statements.
Inquire of management about the methods of preparing the supplementary information, including measurement, presentation, and significant assumptions.
Compare the supplementary information with the audited financial statements and other knowledge obtained during the audit.
Consider including representations from management regarding the supplementary information.
Apply additional procedures as prescribed by professional standards if necessary.
Report on any omissions, material departures, or unresolved doubts regarding the supplementary information.
Expand the audit report if the auditor performs additional procedures or expresses an opinion on the supplementary information.

standard: AS 2705 - Required Supplementary Information
description: Guidance on handling supplementary information that is required by GAAP, including requirements for marking information as unaudited and including disclaimers in the auditor's report if necessary.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure that required supplementary information is clearly marked as unaudited if it is not part of the audited financial statements.
If the supplementary information is not clearly marked as unaudited, expand the auditor's report to include a disclaimer regarding the supplementary information.

standard: AS 2710 - Other Information in Documents Containing Audited Financial Statements
description: Guidance for auditors on their responsibilities regarding other information included in documents containing audited financial statements, including the need to read and consider such information for material inconsistencies.
enforcement_guidelines: Read the other information included in the document for the purpose of identifying material inconsistencies with the financial statements.
