Evaluate whether the other information, or the manner of its presentation, is materially inconsistent with the financial statements.
If a material inconsistency is identified, consider whether the financial statements, the auditor's report, or both require revision.

If the other information is not revised to eliminate the material inconsistency, communicate the inconsistency to the audit committee and consider appropriate actions, such as revising the auditor's report to include an explanatory paragraph.

standard: AS 2801 - Subsequent Events
description: Guidelines for handling subsequent events that may affect the fairness of financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Examine interim financial statements to ensure consistency with the financial statements being audited.
Inquire about significant changes in capital stock, long-term debt, or working capital.
Obtain a written representation from management regarding subsequent events that may require adjustment or disclosure.
Perform additional procedures to address any questions arising from the aforementioned inquiries.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Requirements for obtaining written representations from management during an audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain written representations from management confirming their responsibility for the fair presentation of financial statements.
Confirm that management believes the financial statements are fairly presented in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
Ensure that written representations are provided to the audit committee if not already done by management.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management confirms that the financial statements are fairly presented in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must provide written confirmation of the fairness of the financial statements.
The auditor should verify that the financial statements are prepared in accordance with GAAP.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must provide all financial records, related party information, and meeting minutes.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must provide all financial records and related data.
Management must provide the names of all related parties and their transactions.
Management must provide minutes of meetings of stockholders, directors, and committees.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must report communications from regulatory agencies regarding noncompliance with financial reporting practices.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must disclose any communications from regulatory agencies.
The auditor should review any disclosed communications for materiality.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must confirm the absence of unrecorded material transactions.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must state that there are no unrecorded material transactions.
The auditor should perform procedures to identify unrecorded transactions.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must confirm the immateriality of uncorrected misstatements.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must provide a summary of uncorrected misstatements.
Management must confirm the immateriality of these misstatements.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management acknowledges responsibility for fraud prevention and detection programs.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must acknowledge their responsibility for fraud prevention and detection.
The auditor should assess the effectiveness of these programs.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must report knowledge of fraud or suspected fraud involving specified individuals.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must report any knowledge of fraud involving management or key employees.
The auditor should investigate any reported instances of fraud.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must report allegations of fraud received from specified sources.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must report any allegations of fraud received from employees, former employees, analysts, regulators, short sellers, or others.
The auditor should review any reported allegations.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must report plans or intentions that may affect asset or liability values or classifications.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must disclose any plans or intentions that may affect asset or liability values or classifications.
The auditor should assess the impact of these plans or intentions on the financial statements.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management must report knowledge of any unasserted claims or assessments that are required to be accrued or disclosed.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must report any knowledge of unasserted claims or assessments.
The auditor should verify the disclosure of such claims or assessments.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management confirms that no subsequent events affecting the financial statements have occurred after the balance-sheet date.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must confirm that no subsequent events have occurred that would require adjustment or disclosure in the financial statements.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management confirms that the company has complied with all aspects of contractual agreements that could materially affect the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must confirm compliance with all contractual agreements that could have a material effect on the financial statements.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management confirms that certain transactions and liabilities are properly recorded or disclosed in the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must confirm that related-party transactions, guarantees, contingent liabilities, and other matters are properly recorded or disclosed.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management confirms that there are no violations of laws or regulations that should be disclosed or recorded as a loss contingency.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must confirm that there are no violations or possible violations of laws or regulations that should be disclosed or recorded as a loss contingency.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management confirms that the company has satisfactory title to all owned assets and there are no liens or encumbrances.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must confirm that the company has satisfactory title to all owned assets and there are no liens or encumbrances on such assets.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management confirms that the company has complied with all aspects of contractual agreements that could materially affect the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Management must confirm compliance with all contractual agreements that could have a material effect on the financial statements.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management's responsibility to provide accurate representations regarding deferred tax assets and liabilities.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether management has appropriately considered the need for a valuation allowance against deferred tax assets.
Verify that management's representations regarding deferred tax assets are consistent with the financial statements and disclosures.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management's responsibility to provide accurate representations regarding short-term obligations refinanced on a long-term basis.
enforcement_guidelines: Review the refinancing agreements and confirm that they have been properly disclosed in the financial statements.
Assess whether management's intention to refinance short-term obligations on a long-term basis is reasonable and supported by appropriate evidence.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management's responsibility to provide accurate representations regarding tax-exempt bonds.
enforcement_guidelines: Confirm that tax-exempt bonds have retained their tax-exempt status as represented by management.
Review the financial statements to ensure proper disclosure of the tax-exempt status of the bonds.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management's responsibility to provide accurate representations regarding sales and purchase commitments.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether provisions have been made for potential losses from sales and purchase commitments.
Review the financial statements to ensure that all relevant sales and purchase commitments are properly disclosed and accounted for.

standard: AS 2805 - Management Representations
description: Management's responsibility to provide accurate representations regarding litigation, claims, and assessments.
enforcement_guidelines: Confirm that management has disclosed all pending or threatened litigation, claims, or assessments that could impact the financial statements.
Review the legal documentation and management's representations to ensure that all relevant information has been provided to the auditor.

standard: AS 2810 - Evaluating Audit Results
description: This standard establishes requirements for auditors to evaluate the results of their audits, including the sufficiency and appropriateness of audit evidence, and to determine whether the financial statements are presented fairly in all material respects.
enforcement_guidelines: Accumulate misstatements identified during the audit, excluding those that are clearly trivial.
Evaluate the materiality of uncorrected misstatements, considering both quantitative and qualitative factors.
Evaluate the effects of uncorrected misstatements detected in prior years and those detected in the current year that relate to prior years.
Assess whether identified misstatements might be indicative of fraud and perform additional procedures if necessary.
Communicate findings and implications of misstatements to management and other relevant parties.

standard: AS 2810 - Evaluating Audit Results
description: Auditors must evaluate the qualitative aspects of the company's accounting practices, including potential bias in management's judgments about the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess instances of selective correction of misstatements.
Evaluate the use of adjusting entries that offset misstatements identified during the audit.
Assess bias in the selection and application of accounting principles.
Evaluate bias in accounting estimates and its impact on financial statements.

standard: AS 2810 - Evaluating Audit Results
description: Auditors must conclude on whether sufficient appropriate audit evidence has been obtained to support their opinion on the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the significance of uncorrected misstatements and their potential material effect on the financial statements.
Assess the results of audit procedures performed, including whether the evidence obtained supports or contradicts management's assertions.
Evaluate the appropriateness of the auditor's risk assessments and whether audit procedures need to be modified.
Perform additional procedures if necessary to address identified risks or gaps in audit evidence.

standard: AS 2810 - Evaluating Audit Results
description: This standard outlines the requirements for auditors to evaluate the results of their audits, including the consideration of various factors that could indicate material misstatements or fraud.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify discrepancies in accounting records, including transactions not recorded in a complete or timely manner or improperly recorded as to amount, accounting period, classification, or company policy.
Consider conflicting or missing evidence, including unsupported or unauthorized balances or transactions.

Assess unusual relationships between the auditor and management, including management pressure on engagement team members, particularly in connection with the auditor's critical assessment of audit evidence or the resolution of potential disagreements with management.
Evaluate unusual delays by management in providing requested information.
Consider management's unwillingness to add or revise disclosures in the financial statements to make them more complete and transparent.
Assess management's unwillingness to appropriately address significant deficiencies in internal control on a timely basis.
Evaluate the significance of misstatements, including the effects of misclassifications between operating and non-operating income or recurring and non-recurring income items.

Consider the definitive character of the misstatement, including the precision of an error that is objectively determinable as contrasted with a misstatement that unavoidably involves a degree of subjectivity through estimation, allocation, or uncertainty.
Evaluate the motivation of management with respect to the misstatement, including indications of a possible pattern of bias by management when developing and accumulating accounting estimates.
Consider the likelihood that a misstatement that is currently immaterial may have a material effect in future periods because of a cumulative effect.

standard: AS 2820 - Evaluating Consistency of Financial Statements
description: Auditors must evaluate changes in accounting principles and their material effects on financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate whether the change in accounting principle is a generally accepted accounting principle.
Assess if the method of accounting for the change conforms to generally accepted accounting principles.
Ensure adequate disclosure of the change in accounting principle.
Justify if the alternative accounting principle is preferable.
Add an explanatory paragraph in the auditor's report if the change has a material effect.
Issue a qualified or adverse opinion if the change does not meet the criteria.

standard: AS 2820 - Evaluating Consistency of Financial Statements
description: Auditors must recognize corrections of material misstatements in previously issued financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Add an explanatory paragraph in the auditor's report for corrections of material misstatements.
Include a statement that the previously issued financial statements have been restated for the correction of a misstatement in the respective period.
Reference the note disclosure describing the correction of the misstatement.
Ensure that the explanatory paragraph is included in the year of the correction and subsequent years until the correction is no longer material.

standard: AS 2820 - Evaluating Consistency of Financial Statements
description: Guidance on including an explanatory paragraph in the auditor's report when financial statements are restated to correct a prior material misstatement.
enforcement_guidelines: Include an explanatory paragraph when restating financial statements to correct a prior material misstatement.
Do not repeat the explanatory paragraph in subsequent years unless the restatement continues to be relevant.

standard: AS 2901 - Consideration of Omitted Procedures After the Report Date
description: Guidance on handling situations where an auditor omits an auditing procedure considered necessary at the time of the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the importance of the omitted procedure to the ability to support the previously expressed opinion.
Consult with an attorney to determine an appropriate course of action.
If the omission impairs the ability to support the opinion, promptly apply the omitted procedure or alternative procedures.

standard: AS 2905 - Subsequent Discovery of Facts Existing at the Date of the Auditor's Report
description: This standard outlines the auditor's responsibilities when discovering facts subsequent to the audit report date that could affect the financial statements or the auditor's report.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether the newly discovered information would have affected the auditor's report if known at the report date.
Advise the client to make appropriate disclosure of the newly discovered facts and their impact on the financial statements.
If the client refuses to make necessary disclosures, notify regulatory agencies and persons relying on the financial statements that the auditor's report should no longer be relied upon.

standard: AS 3101 - The Auditor's Report on an Audit of Financial Statements When the Auditor Expresses an Unqualified Opinion
description: This standard establishes the requirements for the content of the auditor's report when expressing an unqualified opinion on financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Include the basic elements of the auditor's report, such as the auditor's name, address, and report date.
Communicate critical audit matters relating to the audit of the current period's financial statements, unless such requirements do not apply.
State that the auditor determined that there are no critical audit matters if applicable.

standard: AS 3101 - The Auditor's Report on an Audit of Financial Statements When the Auditor Expresses an Unqualified Opinion
description: Auditors must determine and communicate critical audit matters in the auditor's report. A critical audit matter is a matter arising from the audit of the financial statements that was communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee and that: (1) relates to accounts or disclosures that are material to the financial statements and (2) involved especially challenging, subjective, or complex auditor judgment.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify critical audit matters that were communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee.
Assess whether the matters relate to accounts or disclosures that are material to the financial statements.
Determine if the matters involved especially challenging, subjective, or complex auditor judgment.

standard: AS 3101 - The Auditor's Report on an Audit of Financial Statements When the Auditor Expresses an Unqualified Opinion
description: For each critical audit matter communicated in the auditor's report, the auditor must: (a) identify the critical audit matter; (b) describe the principal considerations that led the auditor to determine that the matter is a critical audit matter; (c) describe how the critical audit matter was addressed in the audit; and (d) refer to the relevant financial statement accounts or disclosures that relate to the critical audit matter.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify each critical audit matter in the auditor's report.
Describe the principal considerations that led to the determination of each critical audit matter.
Explain how each critical audit matter was addressed during the audit.
Reference the relevant financial statement accounts or disclosures related to each critical audit matter.

standard: AS 3101 - The Auditor's Report on an Audit of Financial Statements When the Auditor Expresses an Unqualified Opinion
description: For each matter arising from the audit of the financial statements that was communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee and relates to accounts or disclosures that are material to the financial statements, the auditor must document whether or not the matter was determined to be a critical audit matter and the basis for such determination.
enforcement_guidelines: Document whether each matter communicated to the audit committee is a critical audit matter.
Record the basis for determining whether a matter is a critical audit matter.
Ensure documentation is maintained for each matter communicated to the audit committee.

standard: AS 3101 - The Auditor's Report on an Audit of Financial Statements When the Auditor Expresses an Unqualified Opinion
description: The auditor must communicate critical audit matters in the auditor's report if they meet the defined criteria.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify critical audit matters that relate to accounts or disclosures material to the financial statements.
Assess whether the matters involved especially challenging, subjective, or complex auditor judgment.
Communicate critical audit matters in the auditor's report, ensuring they are clearly described and cross-referenced if necessary.

standard: AS 3101 - The Auditor's Report on an Audit of Financial Statements When the Auditor Expresses an Unqualified Opinion
description: The auditor may emphasize certain matters in the auditor's report if they are significant to the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify significant transactions, subsequent events, or other matters that require emphasis.
Assess the materiality and significance of the matter to the financial statements.
Draft an emphasis of matter paragraph to highlight the issue and ensure it is appropriately titled.

standard: AS 3101 - The Auditor's Report on an Audit of Financial Statements When the Auditor Expresses an Unqualified Opinion
description: The auditor must include information about the engagement partner and other accounting firms participating in the audit.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify the engagement partner and other accounting firms contributing to the audit.
Obtain the required information, including the firm's legal name, location, and percentage of total audit hours.
Include the information in the auditor's report as specified, ensuring compliance with PCAOB standards.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Qualified opinions are required when there is a lack of sufficient appropriate evidential matter or restrictions on the scope of the audit that prevent the auditor from expressing an unqualified opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the importance of omitted procedures and their impact on the financial statements.
Describe the basis for the qualified opinion in a separate paragraph following the opinion paragraph.
Ensure the opinion paragraph includes qualifying language referencing the effects on the financial statements.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: An adverse opinion must be expressed when the financial statements do not present fairly in all material respects the financial position, results of operations, or cash flows of the entity in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Clearly state that the financial statements do not present fairly in all material respects.
Provide detailed reasons for the adverse opinion in the report.
Ensure the opinion paragraph explicitly states the adverse opinion.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: A disclaimer of opinion is required when the auditor is unable to obtain sufficient appropriate evidential matter necessary to form an opinion on the financial statements as a whole.
enforcement_guidelines: Clearly state that the auditor is unable to express an opinion on the financial statements as a whole.
Provide detailed reasons for the disclaimer of opinion in the report.
Ensure the opinion paragraph explicitly states the disclaimer of opinion.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Auditors must address unaudited information that is material to the financial statements by applying necessary procedures. If unable to do so, they must qualify or disclaim the opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess unaudited information that is material to the financial statements.
Apply necessary auditing procedures to the unaudited information.
If unable to obtain sufficient evidence, qualify or disclaim the opinion.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Auditors must address uncertainties by assessing the sufficiency of evidential matter. If insufficient, qualify or disclaim the opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the sufficiency of evidential matter related to uncertainties.
If insufficient evidence, qualify or disclaim the opinion.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Auditors must determine materiality of departures from GAAP to decide between qualified or adverse opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the materiality of departures from GAAP.
If material, express a qualified or adverse opinion.
State the basis for the opinion in the report.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Auditors must disclose reasons for qualified opinions and effects on financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Disclose reasons for qualified opinions in the report.
State the effects on financial statements if practicable.
Refer to notes if information is already disclosed.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Auditors must address inadequate disclosure in financial statements by qualifying or disclaiming the opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess if required information is missing from financial statements.
If inadequate disclosure, qualify or disclaim the opinion.
Provide necessary information in the report if practicable.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Omission of the statement of cash flows requires qualification of the auditor's opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether the omission of the statement of cash flows is material.
Determine if the omission affects the fairness of the financial statements.
Modify the opinion to reflect the omission and its materiality.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Inadequate disclosure of risks or uncertainties requires a qualified or adverse opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the adequacy of disclosure of risks or uncertainties.
Assess the materiality of the inadequate disclosure.
Express a qualified or adverse opinion based on the materiality.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Departures from GAAP in changes of accounting principles require qualification or adverse opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Determine if the change in accounting principle is justified.
Assess the materiality of the departure from GAAP.
Express a qualified or adverse opinion based on the materiality.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Inappropriate accounting principles require a qualified or adverse opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the appropriateness of the accounting principles used.
Assess the materiality of the departure from GAAP.
Express a qualified or adverse opinion based on the materiality.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Unreasonable accounting estimates require a qualified or adverse opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the reasonableness of management's estimates.
Assess the materiality of the departure from GAAP.
Express a qualified or adverse opinion based on the materiality.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Departures from GAAP in changes of accounting principles require qualification or adverse opinion in subsequent years.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the impact of the accounting change on subsequent years.
Assess the materiality of the departure from GAAP.
Express a qualified or adverse opinion based on the materiality.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Adverse opinions must state that financial statements do not present fairly in conformity with GAAP.
enforcement_guidelines: State that the financial statements do not present fairly in conformity with GAAP.
Disclose the reasons for the adverse opinion.
Explain the effects of the adverse opinion on financial position, results of operations, and cash flows.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Guidelines for disclaiming an opinion when sufficient audit evidence cannot be obtained.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and clearly state the scope limitation that prevents obtaining sufficient appropriate audit evidence.
State that the scope of the audit was not sufficient to warrant the expression of an opinion.
Omit the paragraph describing the characteristics of an audit (scope paragraph) to avoid overshadowing the disclaimer.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Prohibition of piecemeal opinions when disclaiming or expressing an adverse opinion on financial statements taken as a whole.
enforcement_guidelines: Do not express piecemeal opinions (opinions on specific items) when disclaiming an opinion or expressing an adverse opinion on the financial statements as a whole.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Guidelines for updating reports when prior-period financial statements are restated.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify circumstances or events affecting prior-period financial statements.
Assess whether restatement is necessary for compliance with accounting principles.
Communicate changes in opinion to stakeholders.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Requirements when the opinion on prior-period financial statements differs from the previous opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Compare prior-period financial statements with current-period statements.
Obtain representations from management regarding prior-period statements.
Evaluate findings from the successor auditor.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Guidelines for reporting when the predecessor auditor's report is not presented.
enforcement_guidelines: Describe the nature of the predecessor auditor's report.
Explain the reasons for the different opinion.
Include a paragraph about adjustments if applicable.

standard: AS 3105 - Departures from Unqualified Opinions and Other Reporting Circumstances
description: Requirements for including specific statements in the auditor's report when there is a departure from an unqualified opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Include statements in the auditor's report that the company is not required to have an audit of internal control over financial reporting.
State that the auditor was not engaged to perform such an audit.
Indicate that the auditor expresses no opinion on the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.

standard: AS 3110 - Dating of the Independent Auditor's Report
description: Guidelines for dating the auditor's report and handling subsequent events.
enforcement_guidelines: Date the audit report no earlier than the date sufficient appropriate evidence is obtained.
Use dual dating if subsequent events require adjustments or disclosures after the original report date.
Consider the effect of subsequent events on the opinion and date the report accordingly.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for auditors when financial statements are prepared in conformity with a comprehensive basis of accounting other than generally accepted accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Include a title that includes the word 'independent'.
State that the financial statements are the responsibility of management and that the auditor is responsible for expressing an opinion based on the audit.
Conduct the audit in accordance with PCAOB standards and include an identification of the United States of America as the country of origin of those standards.
Express an opinion (or disclaimer of opinion) on whether the financial statements are presented fairly, in all material respects, in conformity with the basis of accounting described.

If applicable, include a separate paragraph stating that the report is intended solely for the information and use of those within the entity and the regulatory agencies to whose jurisdiction the entity is subject.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for auditors when reporting on specified elements, accounts, or items of a financial statement.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether the specified elements, accounts, or items are presented fairly, in all material respects, in conformity with the applicable basis of accounting.
Consider the basis of accounting used in the financial statements.
Include a paragraph in the report stating that the auditor's opinion is limited to the specified elements, accounts, or items and that the financial statements as a whole are not audited.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for auditors when reporting on compliance with aspects of contractual agreements or regulatory requirements related to audited financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain written assertions from management regarding compliance with the specified aspects of contractual agreements or regulatory requirements.
Perform audit procedures to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence regarding compliance with the specified aspects.

Include a paragraph in the report stating that the auditor has examined the financial statements and related schedules and that the financial statements comply with the specified aspects of contractual agreements or regulatory requirements.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for auditors when reporting on special-purpose financial presentations to comply with contractual agreements or regulatory provisions.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether the financial statements are presented fairly, in all material respects, in conformity with the basis of accounting described.
Consider the basis of accounting used in the financial statements.
Include a paragraph in the report stating that the auditor's opinion is limited to the specified elements, accounts, or items and that the financial statements as a whole are not audited.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must modify their report if financial statements do not meet the conditions for presentation in conformity with a comprehensive basis of accounting other than generally accepted accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Verify if the financial statements meet the conditions for presentation in conformity with a comprehensive basis of accounting other than GAAP.
Modify the auditor's report if the financial statements do not meet the required conditions.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must ensure that financial statements are suitably titled when prepared on a basis other than GAAP.
enforcement_guidelines: Review the titles of the financial statements to ensure they are appropriate and clearly indicate the basis of accounting used.
Modify the auditor's report if the titles are deemed misleading or inappropriate.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must evaluate the adequacy of disclosure in financial statements prepared on a basis other than GAAP.
enforcement_guidelines: Review the financial statements and accompanying notes to ensure they include all necessary informative disclosures.
Assess whether the disclosures are clear, complete, and appropriate for the basis of accounting used.
Modify the auditor's report if the disclosures are found to be inadequate.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must plan and perform the audit to express an opinion on specified elements, accounts, or items of a financial statement.
enforcement_guidelines: Plan and perform the audit with a focus on the specified elements, accounts, or items.
Ensure that the specified elements, accounts, or items are presented in conformity with GAAP if applicable.
Follow the requirements of AS 3101 and AS 3105 when expressing an opinion on specified elements, accounts, or items.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must include specific elements in their report when expressing an opinion on one or more specified elements, accounts, or items of a financial statement.
enforcement_guidelines: Include a title that indicates the independence of the auditor.
State that the specified elements, accounts, or items are the responsibility of management.
Explain that the auditor is responsible for expressing an opinion on the specified elements, accounts, or items based on the audit.
Include a paragraph stating that the audit was conducted in accordance with PCAOB standards.

Include a paragraph stating that the standards require the auditor to plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the specified elements, accounts, or items are free of material misstatement.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for reports on specified elements, accounts, or items of financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Include an opinion paragraph expressing whether the specified elements, accounts, or items are fairly presented in all material respects.
Include a paragraph explaining the basis of accounting used for the presentation.
Include a restriction on the use of the report if the presentation is based on a contract or agreement.
Include the auditor's signature, city and state/country, and date in the report.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for audits of specified elements, accounts, or items based on a contract or agreement.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management.
Evaluate the overall presentation of the specified elements, accounts, or items.
Include a paragraph explaining the basis of accounting used for the presentation.
Include a restriction on the use of the report if the presentation is based on a contract or agreement.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for auditors when providing reports on compliance with contractual agreements or regulatory provisions related to audited financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Include a title that includes the word 'independent'.
State that the financial statements were audited in accordance with PCAOB standards and identify the United States as the country of origin of those standards.

Provide negative assurance relative to compliance with applicable covenants insofar as they relate to accounting matters, and state that the audit was not directed primarily toward obtaining knowledge of noncompliance.
Include a paragraph restricting the use of the report to specified parties.
Sign and date the report with the auditor's firm's manual or printed signature.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Requirements for auditors when issuing reports on special-purpose financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Include a title that includes the word 'independent'.
State that the special-purpose financial statements were audited.
State that the financial statements are the responsibility of the entity's management.
State that the auditor is responsible for expressing an opinion on the financial statements based on the audit.
State that the audit was conducted in accordance with PCAOB standards.
Include a paragraph that explains the basis of presentation and that the presentation is not intended to be a presentation in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.
Include a paragraph that expresses the auditor's opinion or disclaimer of opinion.
Include a paragraph that restricts the use of the report to specified parties.
Include the manual or printed signature of the auditor's firm.
Include the city and state (or city and country, for non-U.S. auditors) from which the report was issued.
Include the date.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must add an explanatory paragraph if there is a change in accounting principles or their application, referencing the note discussing the change and its effects.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify changes in accounting principles or their application.
Add an explanatory paragraph with an appropriate title immediately following the opinion paragraph.
Reference the note discussing the change and its effects in the financial statements.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must add an explanatory paragraph if there is substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern for a reasonable period.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern.
Add an explanatory paragraph with an appropriate title after the opinion paragraph if substantial doubt is relevant.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must reference the audit and report of another public accounting firm when dividing audit responsibility.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify situations where audit responsibility is divided with another firm.
Reference the audit and report of the referred-to auditor in compliance with AS 1206.

standard: AS 3305 - Special Reports
description: Auditors must disclose reasons for a different opinion on prior-period financial statements in an explanatory paragraph.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify if the opinion on prior-period financial statements differs from previous opinions.
Disclose all substantive reasons for the different opinion in a separate explanatory paragraph immediately following the opinion paragraph.

standard: AS 3310 - Special Reports on Regulated Companies
description: Guidance for auditors when financial statements of regulated companies are prepared under a prescribed basis of accounting different from GAAP.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether the financial statements comply with the prescribed basis of accounting.
Modify the auditor's report to reflect departures from GAAP.
Ensure the report clearly communicates the basis of accounting used.

standard: AS 3315 - Reporting on Condensed Financial Statements and Selected Financial Data
description: Guidance for auditors when reporting on condensed financial statements derived from audited financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Review condensed financial statements for fairness and material accuracy.
Ensure the report includes a reference to the complete audited financial statements.
Include a statement that the condensed statements are fairly derived from the audited statements.

standard: AS 3315 - Reporting on Condensed Financial Statements and Selected Financial Data
description: Guidelines for auditors when reporting on selected financial data derived from audited financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: State that the auditor has audited the complete financial statements and express an opinion on them.
Specify the selected financial data on which the auditor is reporting.
Indicate that the information set forth in the selected financial data is fairly stated, in all material respects, in relation to the complete financial statements from which it has been derived.
If selected financial data for any of the years presented are derived from financial statements audited by another independent auditor, state that fact and do not express an opinion on that data.

standard: AS 3320 - Association with Financial Statements
description: An accountant must disclaim an opinion when associated with unaudited financial statements of a public entity.
enforcement_guidelines: Issue a disclaimer of opinion stating that the financial statements were not audited or reviewed.
Clearly mark each page of the financial statements as 'unaudited'.
Do not describe any procedures performed beyond reading the financial statements for obvious material misstatements.

standard: AS 3320 - Association with Financial Statements
description: An accountant must disclaim an opinion and state lack of independence when associated with financial statements of a public entity when not independent.
enforcement_guidelines: Modify the disclaimer of opinion to specifically state that the accountant is not independent.
Do not describe the reasons for lack of independence or any procedures performed.
Refuse to be associated with the financial statements if the client does not comply with the requirements.

standard: AS 3320 - Association with Financial Statements
description: An accountant must describe departures from generally accepted accounting principles in the disclaimer of opinion when associated with unaudited financial statements of a public entity.
enforcement_guidelines: Suggest appropriate revisions to the financial statements to conform with GAAP.
Modify the disclaimer of opinion to describe the nature of the departure from GAAP.
Refuse to be associated with the financial statements if the client does not revise them to conform with GAAP.

standard: AS 3320 - Association with Financial Statements
description: An accountant must not include negative assurances in a disclaimer of opinion on unaudited financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Avoid including negative assurances in the disclaimer of opinion.
Ensure that the disclaimer of opinion does not contradict the lack of opinion expressed.

standard: AS 4101 - Responsibilities Regarding Filings Under Federal Securities Statutes
description: Management is responsible for the financial representations contained in documents filed under federal securities statutes. The independent accountant's report serves as a check on management's stewardship but does not absolve management of its primary responsibility.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure that management acknowledges its responsibility for the accuracy of financial statements.
Verify that the independent accountant's report is properly referenced and does not imply greater responsibility than intended.

standard: AS 4101 - Responsibilities Regarding Filings Under Federal Securities Statutes
description: Independent accountants have specific responsibilities when their reports are included in registration statements under the Securities Act of 1933. They must ensure their reports are not misrepresented in the filings.
enforcement_guidelines: Review the prospectus and registration statement to ensure the independent accountant's report is accurately referenced.
Ensure that the prospectus does not imply that the independent accountant is responsible for unaudited interim financial information.

standard: AS 4101 - Responsibilities Regarding Filings Under Federal Securities Statutes
description: Independent accountants must perform a reasonable investigation to fulfill their statutory responsibilities under the Securities Act of 1933. This includes procedures to identify subsequent events that could affect the financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform procedures to identify subsequent events from the date of the audit report to the effective date of the registration statement.
Document the procedures performed and the conclusions reached regarding subsequent events.

standard: AS 4101 - Responsibilities Regarding Filings Under Federal Securities Statutes
description: Independent accountants who have audited prior-period financial statements included in a registration statement must address subsequent events that could affect those prior-period financial statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Review pertinent portions of the prospectus and registration statement related to prior-period financial statements.
Obtain representations from the successor auditor regarding subsequent events that could affect the prior-period financial statements.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Establishes standards and provides guidance on the nature, timing, and extent of procedures for reviewing interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Conduct reviews in accordance with PCAOB standards.
Ensure reviews are designed to identify material modifications needed for interim financial information to conform with GAAP.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Specifies the applicability of the review of interim financial information for SEC registrants and non-SEC registrants.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the review is conducted for SEC registrants.
Conduct reviews for non-SEC registrants making filings with regulatory agencies.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Sets the objective of a review of interim financial information to provide a basis for communicating whether material modifications are needed.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform analytical procedures and make inquiries to identify material modifications.
Communicate findings to management and the audit committee.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Requires establishing an understanding with the audit committee regarding the terms of the engagement for reviewing interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Document the understanding in an engagement letter.
Ensure the engagement letter is executed by the appropriate parties.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The accountant must perform analytical procedures to identify unusual relationships and items that may indicate a material misstatement in the interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Compare the quarterly interim financial information with comparable information for the immediately preceding interim period and the corresponding period in the prior year.
Consider plausible relationships among both financial and nonfinancial information.
Develop expectations based on the entity's business and industry context.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The accountant must perform specific inquiries and review procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Read the available minutes of meetings of stockholders, directors, and appropriate committees.
Obtain reports from other accountants regarding significant components of the reporting entity.
Inquire of management about the conformity of interim financial information with GAAP.
Read other information accompanying the interim financial information to check for material inconsistencies.
Evaluate management's quarterly certifications about internal control over financial reporting.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The accountant must evaluate management's quarterly certifications about internal control over financial reporting.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire of management about significant changes in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting.
Evaluate the implications of misstatements identified during the review procedures.
Determine whether changes in internal control have a material effect on the company's internal control over financial reporting.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Extension of interim review procedures to identify and address potential misstatements in interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess potential misstatements in interim financial information.
Perform additional procedures to resolve questions about conformity with GAAP.
Accumulate and evaluate likely misstatements identified during the review.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Coordination of interim review procedures with the annual audit to ensure consistency and efficiency.
enforcement_guidelines: Coordinate interim review procedures with the annual audit where appropriate.
Use information from interim reviews to inform the annual audit process.
Document coordination efforts and any significant findings.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Evaluation of the results of interim review procedures to determine materiality of misstatements.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate misstatements individually and in the aggregate.
Consider the nature, cause, and amount of misstatements.
Document the evaluation and any conclusions regarding materiality.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Communication of material modifications and other significant matters to management and the audit committee.
enforcement_guidelines: Communicate material modifications to interim financial information to management.
Provide timely communication to the audit committee if management does not respond appropriately.
Document all communications with management and the audit committee.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Consideration of fraud and illegal acts during the review of interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the risk of fraud or illegal acts affecting the interim financial information.
Communicate findings related to fraud or illegal acts to the audit committee.
Document all considerations and communications related to fraud and illegal acts.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The accountant's review report must include the title 'Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm'.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the report title is correctly formatted as 'Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm'.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The review report must be addressed to shareholders and the board of directors, or equivalents for non-corporate entities.
enforcement_guidelines: Address the report to shareholders and the board of directors.
Include additional addressees if applicable.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The first section of the review report must include specific elements such as the company name, reviewed financial information, and conformity with accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Include the company name in the reviewed financial information.
State that the interim financial information was reviewed.
Mention conformity with accounting principles, including country of origin.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The second section must include the responsibility of management, PCAOB standards compliance, procedures description, comparison to audit scope, and auditor registration.
enforcement_guidelines: State that interim financial information is management's responsibility.
Confirm review conducted per PCAOB standards.
Describe review procedures.
Compare review scope to audit scope.
Mention auditor registration with PCAOB.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The review report must include the firm's signature, location, and date.
enforcement_guidelines: Include the firm's signature.
State the city and state (or country for non-U.S. auditors).
Date the report upon completion of review procedures.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The review report must be modified for departures from generally accepted accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Modify the report if material departures are found.
Describe the nature of the departure.
State the effect on interim financial information if practicable.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: The review report must be modified if necessary information for adequate disclosure is missing.
enforcement_guidelines: Modify the report if necessary information is missing.
Include the missing information in the report if practicable.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Guidance for situations where a prior year's audit report included a going-concern paragraph, and conditions continue to exist.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether conditions giving rise to substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern continue to exist.
Ensure adequate and appropriate disclosure about these conditions in the interim financial information.
Consider adding an explanatory paragraph to the review report if appropriate.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Guidance for situations where conditions or events exist as of the interim reporting date that might indicate the entity's possible inability to continue as a going concern.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess whether conditions or events exist that might indicate the entity's possible inability to continue as a going concern.
Ensure adequate and appropriate disclosure about these conditions or events in the interim financial information.
Consider adding an explanatory paragraph to the review report if appropriate.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Guidance for situations where a client represents that the accountant has reviewed interim financial information included in a document filed with a regulatory agency or issued to stockholders or third parties.
enforcement_guidelines: Advise the client that the accountant's review report must be included in the document.
If the client does not agree to include the review report, request that the accountant's name be neither associated with the interim financial information nor referred to in the document.
If the client does not comply with the request, advise the client that the accountant will not consent to the use of his or her name or reference to him or her.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Guidance for documenting the review of interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Prepare documentation that includes findings or issues that are significant, such as results of review procedures that indicate the interim financial information could be materially misstated.
Include actions taken to address such findings and the basis for the final conclusions reached.
Ensure documentation includes the nature, timing, extent, and results of the review procedures performed.
Identify the engagement team member(s) who performed and reviewed the work.
Identify the evidence obtained in support of the conclusion that the interim financial information being reviewed agreed or reconciled with the accounting records.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Management representation letter for a review of interim financial information, confirming the preparation and presentation of interim financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Confirm that the interim financial information has been prepared and presented in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles applicable to interim financial information.
Confirm that all financial records and related data, including names of all related parties and all relationships and transactions with related parties, have been made available to the accountant.

Confirm that all minutes of the meetings of stockholders, directors, and committees of directors, or summaries of actions of recent meetings for which minutes have not yet been prepared, have been made available to the accountant.

Confirm that the effects of any uncorrected financial statement misstatements aggregated by the accountant during the current review engagement and pertaining to the interim period(s) in the current year are immaterial, both individually and in the aggregate, to the interim financial information taken as a whole.

Confirm that there are no significant deficiencies, including material weaknesses, in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the company's ability to record, process, summarize, and report interim financial data.
Confirm that management acknowledges their responsibility for the design and implementation of programs and controls to prevent and detect fraud.

Confirm that management has no knowledge of any fraud or suspected fraud affecting the company involving management, employees who have significant roles in internal control, or others where the fraud could have a material effect on the interim financial information.

Confirm that management has no knowledge of any allegations of fraud or suspected fraud affecting the company in communications from employees, former employees, analysts, regulators, short sellers, or others.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Detailed management representation letter for a review of interim financial information, confirming the preparation and presentation of interim financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Confirm that the interim financial information has been prepared and presented in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles applicable to interim financial information.
Confirm that all financial records and related data, including names of all related parties and all relationships and transactions with related parties, have been made available to the accountant.

Confirm that all minutes of the meetings of stockholders, directors, and committees of directors, or summaries of actions of recent meetings for which minutes have not yet been prepared, have been made available to the accountant.
Confirm that there have been no communications from regulatory agencies concerning noncompliance with or deficiencies in financial reporting practices.
Confirm that there are no material transactions that have not been properly recorded in the accounting records underlying the interim financial information.

Confirm that the effects of any uncorrected financial statement misstatements aggregated by the accountant during the current review engagement and pertaining to the interim period(s) in the current year are immaterial, both individually and in the aggregate, to the interim financial information taken as a whole.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Ensures that there are no significant deficiencies in internal controls affecting the interim financial data.
enforcement_guidelines: Assess the design and operation of internal controls related to interim financial information.
Identify and document any significant deficiencies or material weaknesses.
Communicate findings to management and the audit committee.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Requires management to represent that they have no knowledge of fraud affecting the company.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain written representations from management regarding fraud.
Evaluate the sufficiency and reliability of these representations.
Document the evaluation and any follow-up actions.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Ensures that all uncorrected misstatements are properly recorded or disclosed.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and summarize all uncorrected misstatements.
Ensure proper recording or disclosure of these misstatements.
Provide the schedule of uncorrected misstatements to the audit committee.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Requires management to represent that they have no knowledge of any fraud involving key personnel.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain written representations from management regarding fraud involving key personnel.
Evaluate the sufficiency and reliability of these representations.
Document the evaluation and any follow-up actions.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Ensures that management represents that they have no knowledge of any allegations of fraud.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain written representations from management regarding allegations of fraud.
Evaluate the sufficiency and reliability of these representations.
Document the evaluation and any follow-up actions.

standard: AS 4105 - Reviews of Interim Financial Information
description: Ensures that the company has satisfactory title to all owned assets and no liens or encumbrances.
enforcement_guidelines: Verify ownership of all assets.
Check for any liens or encumbrances on assets.
Document findings and communicate any issues to management.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidance for accountants issuing comfort letters to underwriters and other requesting parties in securities offerings.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure the requesting party provides a written representation letter stating that the review process is consistent with what would be performed if the offering were registered under the Securities Act of 1933.
Include specific disclaimers in the comfort letter regarding the scope of the review and the lack of responsibility for legal interpretations.
Ensure the comfort letter includes statements about the limited scope of the review and the lack of responsibility for updating the letter after the cutoff date.
Do not provide a comfort letter to parties not described in paragraphs .03, .04, or .05; instead, provide a report on agreed-upon procedures as per AT section 201.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Accountants may not issue any additional letters or reports under any other section in connection with the offering or placement of securities, in which the accountants comment on items for which commenting is otherwise precluded by this section.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure that only the comfort letter as per AS 6101 is provided in connection with the offering.
Avoid issuing any other letters or reports that comment on items precluded by this standard.
If additional information is requested, address it within the scope of the comfort letter.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Accountants may not issue any additional letters or reports under any other section in connection with the offering or placement of securities, in which the accountants comment on items for which commenting is otherwise precluded by this section.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure that only the comfort letter as per AS 6101 is provided in connection with the offering.
Avoid issuing any other letters or reports that comment on items precluded by this standard.
If additional information is requested, address it within the scope of the comfort letter.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidance on handling explanatory paragraphs in comfort letters.
enforcement_guidelines: Refer to explanatory paragraphs in the comfort letter.
Discuss the subject matter of the paragraphs.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Procedures for commenting on unaudited interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Perform procedures in accordance with AS 4105.
State in the comfort letter if procedures were performed.
Attach the review report if not already included.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidance on stating independence in comfort letters.
enforcement_guidelines: State independence within the meaning of the Act and SEC rules.
Specify the date of independence statement.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidance on providing assurance on compliance with SEC requirements.
enforcement_guidelines: Provide positive assurance if financial statements were audited.
Provide negative assurance if financial statements were not audited.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Conditions for providing negative assurance on unaudited information.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure knowledge of internal control over financial reporting.
Perform procedures in accordance with AS 4105.
State that findings are based on the specified procedures.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Accountants may provide negative assurance on capsule financial information if it meets specific conditions, including minimum disclosure requirements and an AS 4105 review.
enforcement_guidelines: Verify that capsule financial information meets the minimum disclosure requirements of APB Opinion No. 28.
Conduct an AS 4105 review of the underlying financial statements.
If conditions are not met, limit comments to procedures performed and findings obtained.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Accountants may provide negative assurance on subsequent changes in financial statement items only if the cutoff date is within 135 days of the latest audited period.
enforcement_guidelines: Determine if the cutoff date is within 135 days of the latest audited period.
If within the timeframe, provide negative assurance on subsequent changes.
If beyond the timeframe, limit comments to procedures performed and findings obtained.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Accountants should only comment on financial information derived from accounting records subject to internal controls and avoid assurance on non-financial data.
enforcement_guidelines: Comment only on information expressed in dollars or derived from accounting records under internal controls.
Avoid providing assurance on non-financial data such as square footage or employee counts.
Clearly state the basis of the comments to avoid implying broader assurance.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: This standard outlines the requirements for accountants' letters (comfort letters) provided to underwriters and other requesting parties in connection with securities offerings. It specifies the information to be included in such letters, the procedures to be performed, and the manner in which findings are communicated.
enforcement_guidelines: State the independence of the accountants with respect to the company.
Provide negative assurance on the conformity of unaudited interim financial information with the applicable accounting requirements of the Securities Act of 1933 and related rules and regulations.
State the inability to express an opinion on unaudited interim financial information.
Describe the procedures performed to review the unaudited interim financial information.
Communicate findings and any material changes in the financial statements or other relevant matters.
Include a concluding paragraph specifying the purpose and limitations of the comfort letter.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for auditors to provide letters of comfort to underwriters and other requesting parties, outlining the procedures and representations made regarding financial statements and related matters.
enforcement_guidelines: Confirm independence with respect to the company and its subsidiaries.
Review the unaudited consolidated financial statements for specific periods and inquire about their consistency with audited statements.
Inquire about the basis of unaudited financial statements and their compliance with applicable accounting requirements.
Check for any material modifications needed to ensure unaudited statements conform to generally accepted accounting principles.
Verify that unaudited financial statements do not have material inconsistencies with previously audited statements.
Assess changes in capital stock, long-term debt, net current assets, or stockholders' equity compared to prior periods.
Evaluate decreases in net sales, income before extraordinary items, or net income compared to the corresponding period in the prior year.
Ensure that any changes, increases, or decreases are disclosed in the registration statement.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Commenting on pro forma financial information in a registration statement.
enforcement_guidelines: Read the unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated balance sheet and statements of income and cash flows.
Inquire of company officials about the application of pro forma adjustments.
Prove the arithmetic accuracy of the application of pro forma adjustments to historical amounts.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Commenting on a financial forecast in a registration statement.
enforcement_guidelines: Read the forecasted consolidated balance sheet and statements of income and cash flows.
Compare the forecasted amounts with the company's accounting records.
Prove the arithmetic accuracy of the forecasted amounts.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Commenting on tables, statistics, and other financial information in a registration statement.
enforcement_guidelines: Read the specified tables, statistics, and other financial information.
Compare the information with the company's accounting records.
Verify the arithmetic accuracy of the information.
Inquire of company officials about compliance with applicable regulations.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for auditors when providing letters to underwriters and other requesting parties regarding financial information in registration statements.
enforcement_guidelines: Read and understand the specified sections of the registration statement and related financial information.
Perform audit procedures to verify the accuracy and consistency of the financial data presented.
Compare the financial information with audited financial statements, unaudited financial statements, or other reliable sources.
Inquire of company officials regarding the sufficiency of disclosure and the accuracy of the financial information.
Ensure that the letter is not used for any purpose other than assisting underwriters in their investigation of the company's affairs.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for revising the introductory paragraph when the audit report includes an explanatory paragraph about a lawsuit.
enforcement_guidelines: Revise the introductory paragraph to reference the explanatory paragraph regarding the lawsuit.
Mention that the matter is discussed in Note 8 to the consolidated financial statements.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for revising the introductory paragraph when the SEC has agreed to a departure from their accounting requirements.
enforcement_guidelines: Revise paragraph 2 to include the phrase 'as agreed to by representatives of the SEC.'
Mention the specific departure, such as omitting separate financial statements of an equity investee.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for revising paragraphs 4, 5, and 6 when recent earnings data is presented in capsule form.
enforcement_guidelines: Revise paragraph 4 to include procedures for reviewing interim financial information.
Revise paragraph 5 to address the sufficiency of procedures for the requesting party's purposes.
Revise paragraph 6 to include inquiries about changes in financial statement items.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for revising paragraph 5b when accountants are aware of a decrease in a financial statement item.
enforcement_guidelines: Revise paragraph 5b to address the decrease in consolidated net current assets.
Include specific financial data showing the decrease.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for revising paragraph 5b when accountants are aware of a decrease in a financial statement item.
enforcement_guidelines: Revise paragraph 5b to address the decrease in consolidated net current assets.
Include specific financial data showing the decrease.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Reading and agreeing unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements with accounting records.
enforcement_guidelines: Read the unaudited condensed consolidated balance sheet as of March 31, 19X6, and the unaudited condensed consolidated statements of income, retained earnings (stockholders' equity), and cash flows for the three-month periods ended March 31, 19X6 and 19X5, included in the registration statement.
Agree the amounts contained therein with the company's accounting records as of March 31, 19X6 and 19X5, and for the three-month periods then ended.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Inquiring about conformity with GAAP and compliance with accounting requirements.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire of certain officials of the company who have responsibility for financial and accounting matters whether the unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements referred to in 4b(i) are stated on a basis substantially consistent with that of the audited consolidated financial statements included in the registration statement.

Inquire whether at May 31, 19X6, there was any change in the capital stock, increase in long-term debt, or any decrease in consolidated net current assets or stockholders' equity of the consolidated companies as compared with amounts shown on the March 31, 19X6, unaudited condensed consolidated balance sheet included in the registration statement.

Inquire whether for the period from April 1, 19X6, to May 31, 19X6, there were any decreases, as compared with the corresponding period in the preceding year, in consolidated net sales or in the total or per-share amounts of income before extraordinary items or of net income.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Inquiring about changes in financial statement items after May 31, 19X6.
