enforcement_guidelines: Inquire of certain officials of the company who have responsibility for financial and accounting matters whether (a) at June 23, 19X6, there was any change in the capital stock, increase in long-term debt, or any decrease in consolidated net current assets or stockholders' equity of the consolidated companies as compared with amounts shown on the March 31, 19X6, unaudited condensed consolidated balance sheet included in the registration statement, or (b) for the period from April 1, 19X6, to June 23, 19X6, there were any decreases, as compared with the corresponding period in the preceding year, in consolidated net sales or in the total or per-share amounts of income before extraordinary items or of net income.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for auditors when issuing letters to underwriters and other requesting parties, including the scope of procedures performed and the limitations of such letters.
enforcement_guidelines: Compare financial information in offering documents with audited financial statements to ensure agreement.
Inquire of company officials regarding the consistency of unaudited financial statements with generally accepted accounting principles.
Perform specific audit procedures and document the scope and limitations of the work performed.
Clearly state that the procedures performed do not constitute an audit and that no opinion is expressed on the sufficiency of the procedures for the requesting party's purposes.

standard: AS 6101 - Letters for Underwriters and Certain Other Requesting Parties
description: Guidelines for accountants when providing comfort letters to underwriters, including procedures for inquiring about compliance with accounting requirements, detecting changes in financial statements, and providing negative assurance on interim financial information.
enforcement_guidelines: Inquire of company officials regarding compliance of unaudited financial statements with applicable accounting requirements of the Act and related SEC rules and regulations.

Perform procedures to detect changes in financial statements, including changes in capital stock, long-term debt, net current assets, stockholders' equity, net sales, income before extraordinary items, and net income.

Provide negative assurance on interim financial information if a review has been performed, stating that nothing came to the accountants' attention that caused them to believe that the interim financial information does not conform with generally accepted accounting principles.

standard: AS 6105 - Reports on the Application of Accounting Principles
description: Guidance for reporting accountants on the purpose of their report and the procedures to be followed.
enforcement_guidelines: Understand the form and substance of the transaction(s)
Review applicable accounting principles
Consult with other professionals or experts if appropriate
Perform research or other procedures to ascertain and consider the existence of credible precedents or analogies

standard: AS 6105 - Reports on the Application of Accounting Principles
description: Prohibition on engagements involving hypothetical transactions.
enforcement_guidelines: Do not undertake an engagement to provide a written report on the application of accounting principles to a hypothetical transaction
Advise the client of the prohibition and the reasons therefor

standard: AS 6105 - Reports on the Application of Accounting Principles
description: Performance standards for reporting accountants.
enforcement_guidelines: Exercise due professional care in performing the engagement
Plan the engagement adequately
Supervise the work of assistants, if any
Accumulate sufficient information to provide a reasonable basis for the professional judgment described in the report

standard: AS 6105 - Reports on the Application of Accounting Principles
description: Procedures for evaluating accounting principles.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain an understanding of the form and substance of the transaction(s)
Review applicable accounting principles
Consult with other professionals or experts if appropriate
Perform research or other procedures to ascertain and consider the existence of credible precedents or analogies

standard: AS 6105 - Reports on the Application of Accounting Principles
description: Guidance for evaluating accounting principles and consulting with the continuing accountant.
enforcement_guidelines: Consult with the continuing accountant of the entity to ascertain all the available facts relevant to forming a professional judgment
Obtain information regarding the form and substance of the transaction
Consider how management has applied accounting principles to similar transactions
Consider whether the method of accounting recommended by the continuing accountant is disputed by management
Consider the impact of the information obtained on the report

standard: AS 6105 - Reports on the Application of Accounting Principles
description: Guidelines for reporting on the application of accounting principles, including the structure and content of written reports.
enforcement_guidelines: Include a brief description of the engagement and compliance with PCAOB standards.
Identify the specific entity, describe the transaction, and state relevant facts, circumstances, and assumptions.
State the appropriate accounting principles and the reasons for the conclusion.
Include a statement on the responsibility of financial statement preparers.
Include a restricted use paragraph specifying the intended users of the report.

standard: AS 6110 - Compliance Auditing Considerations in Audits of Recipients of Governmental Financial Assistance
description: Guidance for auditors on compliance with laws and regulations in audits of governmental entities and recipients of financial assistance.
enforcement_guidelines: Understand the effects of laws and regulations on financial statements.
Assess management's identification of applicable laws and regulations.
Design the audit to detect material misstatements due to violations of laws and regulations.
Obtain an understanding of the effects of laws and regulations on financial statements.

standard: AS 6110 - Compliance Auditing Considerations in Audits of Recipients of Governmental Financial Assistance
description: Auditors must assess compliance with laws and regulations affecting federal financial assistance programs and report on compliance with applicable requirements.
enforcement_guidelines: Consider knowledge about such laws and regulations obtained from prior years' audits.
Discuss such laws and regulations with the entity's chief financial officer, legal counsel, or grant administrators.
Obtain written representation from management regarding the completeness of management's identification of applicable laws and regulations.
Review the relevant portions of any directly related agreements, such as those related to grants and loans.
Evaluate the effect of identified instances of noncompliance on each major federal financial assistance program.

standard: AS 6110 - Compliance Auditing Considerations in Audits of Recipients of Governmental Financial Assistance
description: Auditors must communicate with management and the audit committee if an audit in accordance with PCAOB standards may not satisfy other legal, regulatory, or contractual requirements.
enforcement_guidelines: Communicate to management and the audit committee if an audit in accordance with PCAOB standards may not satisfy other legal, regulatory, or contractual requirements.
Document the communication in the working papers if the communication is oral.

Consider how the client's actions in response to such communication relate to other aspects of the audit, including the potential effect on the financial statements and on the auditor's report on those financial statements.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: This standard establishes requirements and provides direction for auditors when engaged to report on whether a previously reported material weakness in internal control over financial reporting continues to exist as of a date specified by management.
enforcement_guidelines: The auditor must obtain reasonable assurance about whether the previously reported material weakness exists as of the specified date.
The auditor must evaluate evidence about the design and operating effectiveness of the specified controls as of the specified date.
The auditor must ensure that management has accepted responsibility for the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.

The auditor must verify that management has evaluated the effectiveness of the specific control(s) addressing the material weakness using the same control criteria as their most recent annual assessment.
The auditor must confirm that management has provided sufficient evidence, including documentation, to support their assertion about the effectiveness of the controls.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: This standard outlines the requirements for auditors to report on whether a previously reported material weakness in a company's internal control over financial reporting continues to exist.
enforcement_guidelines: The auditor must obtain sufficient appropriate evidence about the design and operating effectiveness of specified controls that provide reasonable assurance that the company's stated control objective(s) are achieved.
The auditor must evaluate management's evidence supporting its assertion that the material weakness no longer exists.

The auditor must determine whether management has selected an appropriate date for its assertion and whether the specified date permits the auditor to obtain sufficient evidence supporting his or her opinion.

The auditor must test the operating effectiveness of the specified controls over a period of time that is adequate to determine whether, as of the date specified in management's assertion, the controls necessary for achieving the stated control objective are operating effectively.

The auditor must evaluate whether to use the work performed by others in the engagement and determine the extent to which the auditor may use the work of others to alter the nature, timing, or extent of the work the auditor otherwise would have performed.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: The auditor must evaluate whether a previously reported material weakness continues to exist by assessing the effectiveness of specified controls and obtaining sufficient evidence to support management's assertion.
enforcement_guidelines: Evaluate the sufficiency of evidence obtained from all sources, including management's assertions and the results of the auditor's evaluation of the design and operating effectiveness of the specified controls.
Use the work of others only if it provides a tangible benefit and the degree of competence and objectivity of the individuals performing the work is high.
Perform walkthroughs to assess the operating effectiveness of the specified controls.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: The lead auditor must not divide responsibility for the engagement with another accounting firm.
enforcement_guidelines: Ensure that the lead auditor retains full responsibility for the engagement.
Document the lead auditor's accountability for the engagement and any related decisions.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: Management must provide written representations regarding their responsibility for internal control over financial reporting and the effectiveness of specified controls.
enforcement_guidelines: Obtain written representations from management acknowledging their responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting.
Ensure that management's representations include statements regarding the effectiveness of the specified controls and the assertion that the material weakness no longer exists.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: Management's report must include specific elements such as statements of responsibility, control criteria, identification of the material weakness, and the assertion that it no longer exists.
enforcement_guidelines: Verify that management's report includes a statement of responsibility for internal control over financial reporting.
Ensure that the report identifies the control criteria used by management to conduct the evaluation.
Confirm that the report includes the identification of the material weakness and the assertion that it no longer exists.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: The auditor's report must include specific elements such as the title, description of the material weakness, management's assertion, and the auditor's opinion.
enforcement_guidelines: Include the word 'independent' in the title of the auditor's report.
Describe the material weakness identified in the auditor's previous report.
Identify management's assertion that the material weakness no longer exists.
State that management is responsible for its assertion.
Express an opinion on whether the material weakness continues to exist as of the date of management's assertion.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: Requirements for the auditor's report on whether a previously reported material weakness continues to exist.
enforcement_guidelines: Include a statement that the engagement was conducted in accordance with PCAOB standards.
State that the auditor was not engaged to audit internal control over financial reporting.
State that the auditor does not express an opinion on the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.
State that the auditor does not express an opinion on any other controls.
State that the auditor's report is limited to the matters described in the report.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: Requirements for the auditor's responsibilities when a material weakness continues to exist.
enforcement_guidelines: If the auditor concludes that a material weakness continues to exist, the auditor must express an opinion that the material weakness exists as of the date specified by management.
If the auditor does not issue a report in this circumstance, the auditor must communicate, in writing, his or her conclusion that a material weakness continues to exist to the audit committee.

The auditor must consider that conclusion as part of his or her evaluation of management's quarterly disclosures about internal control over financial reporting, as required by AS 4105.07 and AS 4105.29-.32.

standard: AS 6115 - Reporting on Whether a Previously Reported Material Weakness Continues to Exist
description: This standard addresses the auditor's responsibility to report on whether a previously reported material weakness in internal control over financial reporting continues to exist. It provides guidance on the auditor's procedures, including obtaining an understanding of the company's internal control over financial reporting, examining evidence supporting management's assertion, and performing other necessary procedures.
enforcement_guidelines: Identify and assess the previously reported material weakness in internal control over financial reporting.

Obtain an understanding of the company's internal control over financial reporting as part of the previous audit and update that understanding as it relates to changes in internal control over financial reporting associated with the material weakness.
Examine evidence supporting management's assertion that the material weakness no longer exists.
Perform other procedures as necessary to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the previously reported material weakness continues to exist.
Express an opinion on whether the identified material weakness continues to exist as of the specified date.
